Norma Amelia tiene 40 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en el distrito de Morropon, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, es una comunidad conocida como Capital del Tondero, ubicado en la región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas y golosinas desde hace dos años, cuenta con clientela considerable, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de golosinas y de esta manera ofrecerlo a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Norma Amelia is 40 years old. She lives with her son in the district of Morropon, in a community called Capital del Tondero, located in the Piura region on the North Coast of Peru. The people here farm, engage in commerce and raise animals.  

Norma Amelia has been selling drinks and sweets for the past two years. She has a considerable clientele. She has requested a loan of 500 PEN to buy a variety of sweets to offer to her clients and in this way make more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of sweets to stock her business.

loans.name: Aleta Group

texts.en:
SAIRISI, who is in her early 20s, is single with two children who are still small.  She has been selling shoes, women's bags and clothes door to door.  SAIRISI is an orphan and so she started business when she was fifteen years old. She works from 3pm to 6pm daily, just four hours after being finished with her house activities, like cooking for her kids, fetching water and other chores. With this time, Sairisi is able to make a good monthly report.    

This is her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loan to buy more shoes, women's bags and clothes for her business. She has paid back successfully her previous loan. She is really working hard. She used her business profit to cover household expenses, and part of it was saved and plowed back into her business. Sairisi will use this loan to buy shoes, bags, earrings and make-up to meet her customers' demands. She dreams that one day she will be a successful businesswoman with a big shop. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "ALETA" which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy shoes, bags, earrings and make-up to meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Segundo Pedro

texts.es:
Segundo Pedro tiene 38 años de edad, vive junto a esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pomahuaca, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, es una comunidad que se caracteriza por un clima caluroso, ubicado a dos horas con veinte minutos de la ciudad de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de cafeto, tiene sus sembríos en la arte rural de su distrito, cuenta con mucha experiencia en el rubro, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para su cultivos y de esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo Pedro is 38 years old.  He lives with his wife and kids in the Pomahuaca district, where people work in agriculture, sell products, and raise livestock.  This area has a hot climate, and is located two hours and twenty minutes from the city of Jaén in the Cajamarca region of the north coast of Peru.  

Segundo Pedro works in agriculture, especially coffee production.  He has fields in the rural part of his district.  He has a lot of experience in this line of work.  Segundo Pedro has requested a loan of 2,000 PEN to buy fertilizer for his crops so he can have a better output to offer his customers and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee fields

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María Elena tiene 58 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Morropon, una ciudad conocida por la Capital del Tondero, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella tiene un negocio ubicado en su domicilio, donde realiza el alquiler de play station, cuenta con clientela considerable, su esposos le apoya en esta labor, María Elena ha solcitado un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles para el mantenimiento de sus equipos y de esta manera seguir brindando el servicio, lo que le generar ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is 58, lives with her family in the district of Morropon, a city known as Capital del Tondero, its population works in agriculture, commerce and stockbreeding farming located in the region of Piura, north coast of Peru.

She has a business located at home, where she rents play stations, she has a considerable amount of clientele, her husband suports her in this activity, Maria Elena has requested a loan of 800 PEN to maintain the equipment and continue providing this service, which generates income for her family.

loans.use: to give maintenance to equipment.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina tiene 47 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon, que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora, cerveza y abarrotes al por menor y mayor, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de insumos para la preparación de sus bebidas y de esta manera ofrecer a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Martina is 47, lives with her family in the district of Buenos Aires, a community that works in agriculture, commerce and stockbreeding, located in the province of Morropon, that belongs to the region of Piura, in the north coast of Peru.

She works selling “chicha de jora” (Peruvian corn-based beer), beer and groceries at retail and wholesale, her business is located at her residence and she is requesting a loan of 1,500 PEN to buy ingredients to prepare her drinks and be able to offer them to her customers, generating more income for her family.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make "chicha de jora" (Peruvian corn drink)

loans.name: Sultonboy

texts.en:
The borrower has been involved in agriculture for 15 years and grows mainly corn and vegetables. He sells his crops to the basic grain dealers located near his place of residence. With the profits he earns from sales he helps cover family expenses. He lives with his family in his own home. When farm season is over, the borrower is busy with animal husbandry.

He is requesting a loan to buy farm supplies to help with his cultivating activity, such as fertilizers and seeds, so he can improve the cropland to earn more income. What he sells now is not enough to cover expenses, so the loan will help him continue covering household expenses without limitation.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Karrar

texts.en:
Karrar is a hardworking youth client from Iraq. He is 20 years old, married and has a single child. He and his wife both work to provide the family income.

Karrar owns a small shop where he sells toys and gift items for children. His father handed over this business to him after showing his wide knowledge of the market with good skills in selling. Karrar has been running this shop since 2011 and has gained wide experience that he practices. Thanks to his wide knowledge of the market, he gained an excellent reputation in the surrounding area.

He is applying for a youth loan of 1,800 USD. He will use this loan to install an external ceiling and to increase his inventory by buying more toys to sell. Karrar is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he may be able to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to install an external ceiling and to increase his inventory by buying more toys to sell.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 32 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es: Doña Marta es originaria de la ciudad de Chinandega. Madre soltera de 7 hijos. Tiene 60 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a vender alimento concentrado para animales. Marta es una mujer emprendedora que desde muy joven se dedicó al comercio en diferentes actividades y con el paso del tiempo logro establecer un negocio de venta de concentrado. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de Concentrado, Sales minerales, Cal hidratada entre otros. Su plan futuro es incrementar sus ventas y obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Marta is a native of the city of Chinandega. She is 60 years old and the single mother of 7 children. She is a merchant by trade, selling concentrated feeds for animals. Marta is an enterprising woman who since she was young has worked in many kinds of businesses and with the passing of time has managed to establish a concentrated food business. She is requesting a loan to buy concentrated feed, mineral salts, calcium hydroxide, etc. Her plan for the future is to increase her sales and make more income.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed, mineral salts, calcium hydroxide, etc.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a single woman with no children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years, she has operated a mat weaving business. She sells the mats from home to her neighbors and passersby. Mbeyu faces seasonality as a major business challenge.

With the 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase more palm leaves for her business. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to obtain a loan to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more palm leaves for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more drinks, red oil and imported oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional tools and equipment spare parts to increase his efficiency and productivity

loans.name: Joanna

texts.en:
This is Joanna, 30, resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Ardy, an auto mechanic and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Joanna operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php 20,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Joanna dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to have a better future.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKOLA, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 42 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Fala Sidibela, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales et l’habillement.                                                                 
Les femmes du groupe BENKOLA sont à leurs vingt deuxième prêts solidaires qui sera utilisé pour acheter des céréales les condiments.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
La cliente SITAN, la première personne à partir de la droite est vendeuse de riz. Elle compte acheter 12 sacs de riz non décortiqué chez les producteurs. Ce riz sera décortiqué et vendu au marché et à la famille à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 60.000FCFA par mois. Ce bénéfice sera réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle compte  diversifier son activité en vendant d’autres céréales.
texts.en:
The BENKOLA group is made up of married women who average 42 years old with 3 children each, and who all live in extended traditional families in the village of Fala Sidibela, in the commune of Massigui, in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic Mali). They met through family, neighborhood and friendship connections.

The members sell grains and clothing. The women of the BENKOLA group are on their 22nd solidarity loan, which will be used to buy grains and condiments. 

Sitan, the first person on the right, sells rice. She plans on buying 12 bags of unhulled rice from producers. This rice will be hulled and sold at the market and at home to male and female customers. She hopes to earn an average income of 60,000 CFA Francs per month. These profits will be reinvested in the business. She intends to diversify her business by selling other grains.

loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: Jose Orlando

texts.es:
José Orlando tiene 39 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Querocotillo, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de café, comercio y ganadería, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Cutervo, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de Cafeto de la variedad Catimor, desde hace 10 años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para su cultivo de café y de esta manera tener una buena producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
José Orlando is 39 years old. He lives with his wife in the district of Querocotillo located two hours from the city of Cutervo which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the North Andes of Peru. The people here work in agriculture, especially growing coffee, trade and raise livestock.

José Orlando is a farmer who has been growing mainly the Catimor varietal of coffee for the last 10 years. He has requested a loan of 2000 PEN to buy fertilizers for his coffee crops. In this way he will have a good harvest to offer his clients, making more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to assist his coffee crops.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 53 years old and married with five children. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. 

She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Vilma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Santos Feliciano

texts.es:
Santos Feliciano tiene 66 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el Caserío de Huancas una zona rural del distrito de Querocotillo, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Cutervo, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo de arroz desde hace quince años, son una familia unida que se esfuerza en l alabor que realizan, Santos ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para mantenimiento de su cultivo de arroz y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Santos Feliciano is 66 years old. He lives with his wife in Caserío de Huancas a rural area of the district of Querocotillo, located two hours from the city of Cutervo in the Cajamarca region of the North Andes in Peru. The people here are farmers, trade and raise livestock. 

Santos has grown rice for the past 15 years. They are a united family who make great effort in the work they do. Santos has requested a loan of 4000 PEN to buy fertilizers to maintain his rice crops and in doing this generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his rice crops.

loans.name: Meredian

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Meredian works hard to support her family.

She has an internet cafe business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Meredian is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy computer supplies for her internet cafe.

Meredian has been sustaining her business activities through her past twelve loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy computer supplies for her internet cafe.

loans.name: Nadzuwa

texts.en:
Nadzuwa is asking for a loan because she believes that through it she will improve her business. The previous loan enabled her to save money from her grocery store. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 KES to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice, cooking oil, and tea leaves to sell.

Nadzuwa feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan which, to date, has allowed her to maintain her level of profits to help her family cover their personal expenses.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice, cooking oil, and tea leaves to sell

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has had a dry goods business in the Philippines for two years.

Analyn has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like pants, blouses, bags and other ready-to-wear clothing.

In the future, Analyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, bags and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank, a married man, has eight children. Driven by the need to provide for his big family and meet their basic needs, he opted to begin selling second hand clothes. He started this business in 1998, because the clothes were affordable and the demand was there. 

With the profits, he has been able to build a permanent house for his family and to educate his children. He increased his stock with new clothes that were preferred by children. He will use the loan to buy a stock of clothes for selling during the festive season. In the photograph is Frank (on the right), his wife and the Ugafode credit officer (sitting down).

loans.use: To buy clothes for selling.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is a youth client from Iraq. He is 26 years old, single and lives with his family composed of five members, three of whom are employed and share the family income together.
 
Haydar owns a small shop for selling spare parts for specific cars. After gaining enough experience in this field from his father, he established his own business in 2009 and now he has a hired employee. He has built up good experience in this field and has an excellent reputation in his area. Haydar is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD to install a second ceiling and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to enhance his current life financial conditions.

loans.use: to install a second ceiling and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.es:
José del Carmen tiene 69 años de edad vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura principalmente a al cultivo de maíz, chala, arroz, comercio y ganadería, ubicado a una hora con veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público, con la ayuda de su esposa se dedican a la crianza y venta de de animales menores borregos, aves en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos para darle mantenimiento a su vehículo y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
José del Carmen, 69, lives with his family in the Cayalti district.  People in this area work in agriculture, producing mainly corn, corn husks, and rice, as well as raising livestock and selling products.  The district is located an hour and twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region of the north coast of Peru.  

José del Carmen provides a public transportation service.  He and his wife also raise and sell small animals - sheep and birds - behind their house.  He has requested a loan of 2,500 PEN to buy parts to repair his vehicle so he can generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Luz Con Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUZ CON ESPERANZA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Esperanza es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de blusas, costura de polleras, taller de zapatería, tienda de barrio, trenzado de mantas, venta de comida, artesanías.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Esperanza es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió en un trabajo anterior, donde realizaba los mismos productos, posteriormente decide independizarse.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana y flecos) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las el área de salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “LUZ CON ESPERANZA” community association is in its first cycle of Pro Mujer, as part of the Collpani center.  It’s made up of eight members and directed by a board of directors where Esperanza serves as the president.  The members’ businesses include making blouses and skirts, shoe repair, a neighborhood store, rug braiding, food sales, and arts and crafts.

This loan will benefit their small companies, of which Esperanza is a part.  She says that this is her first time with Pro Mujer, having joined on the invitation of a friend who is also a member.  Currently she has a knitting business and sells blankets.  She says that she learned this business in her previous job, where she did the same thing.  She later decided to go on her own.

This loan will allow her to increase her capital (buy yarn and fringe) from the stores in La Paz and then she will use it to make and sell in her space.  This will allow her to generate income to maintain her household.  She lives with her husband and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health care that it offers.

loans.use: to buy yarn and fringe.

loans.name: Amy Leah

texts.en:
Amy Leah works hard to support her family. She is married and has had a tailoring business in the Philippines for two years.

Amy Leah has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy supplies for her tailoring business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anyela Lolita

texts.es:
Anyela Lolita tiene 18 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Buenos Aires, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus bosques de algarrobo a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza cremas, cosméticos, perfumes y joyas desde hace más de un año, cuenta con clientela considerable ya que brinda asesoramiento a sus clientes que en la mayoría son mujeres, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de cosméticos para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Anyela Lolita is 18 years old. She lives with her family in the district of Buenos Aires, whose population is engaged in agriculture, trade and livestock. The community is characterized by its carob forests, two hours from the city of Piura, on the north coast of Peru.

For over a year she has made a living in the sale of beauty products, creams, cosmetics, perfumes, and jewelry. She has developed a considerable client base, as she offers advice to her customers, who are mostly women. 

She has requested a loan of 1000 nuevos soles for the purchase of cosmetics to restock her business and thus generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to restock her business

loans.name: Djamadjigui Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJAMADJIGUI, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 41 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Fala Sidibela, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce  de céréales, de condiments, d’arachides, d’habillements et  de la restauration. Les femmes du groupe DJAMADJIGUI sont à leur premier prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
La cliente MARIAM, 1 ère assise à droite est la vendeuse d’arachide du groupe. Elle compte acheter 4 sacs d’arachide non décortiquées auprès des producteurs. L’arachide sera décortiquée et vendu  au marché et à la maison à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20.000FCFA par mois. Ce bénéfice sera en partie réinvesti dans l’activité et le remboursement des tontines.
texts.en:
The DJAMADJIGUI group is made up of married women who average 41 years old with 5 children each, and all live in traditional extended families in a village called Fala Sidibela, in the Massigui commune, in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They met through family, neighborhood and friendship connections. 

They sell grains, condiments, peanuts, clothing, and prepared food. The women of the DJAMADJIGUI group are seeking their first solidarity loan. 

Mariam, the first person seated on the right, is the group member who sells peanuts. She plans on buying 4 bags of unshelled peanuts from producers. The peanuts will be shelled and sold at the market and at home to male and female customers. 

She hopes to earn an average monthly income of 20,000 CFA Francs. Part of this income will be reinvested in the business, and part will go towards reimbursing the tontines [savings group].

loans.use: Achat d’arachide

loans.name: Domiciano

texts.es:
Domiciano tiene 59 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío de Nuevo Oriente, una zona rural del distrito de Santo Tomás, una comunidad hospitalaria, su población se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente café, yucas y frutales, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Cutervo, que pertenece a la región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado vacuno, posee 9 reses de su propiedad, comercializándolos en la plaza de ganado, lugar donde se reúnen criadores y compradores, también se dedica al cultivo de café de la variedad catimor, son una familia unida que se esfuerza en la labor que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 500 nuevos soles para la compra de dos cabezas de ganado vacuno y posteriormente ofrecerlo a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Domiciano is 59, lives with his wife and children at Caserio de Nuevo Oriente, a rural zone of the district of Santo Tomas, a hospitable community, its population works in agriculture; particularly coffee, yucca and fruits, commerce and stockbreeding, it's located in the province of Cutervo , which belongs to the region of Cajamarca, north of Peru.

He works raising and selling cattle, he owns 9 heads of cattle, that he commercializes at the cattle plaza, place where the farmers and buyers meet, he also works growing coffee of the catimor variety, they are a close family that works hard at their job, he requested a loan of 4,500 PEN to buy two heads of cattle to later sell at a better price.

loans.use: to buy two heads of dairy cattle.

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.es:
Celedonia tiene 57 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta y crianza de animales de corral pollos, pavos, gallinas entre otros, también brinda servicio de jornalería, ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 500 nuevos soles para construcción de corrales para una mejor distribución de sus animales y de esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Celedonia is 57 and lives with her family in Oyotún District in Chiclayo Province, which is part of the Labayeque Region along the northern coast of Peru. People around Oyotún work on farms and ranches and in shops.  

Celedonia raises and sells fowl - such as young chickens, turkeys, and hens - and also does day labor. She has applied for a loan of 4,500 new soles to build pens that will allow her to manage her flock better, increase production for her customers, and boost her family's income.

loans.use: to build pens for raising young fowl.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 27 years old, and is a married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Corazon has had a food stall business in the Philippines for two years. She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Kushtrim

texts.en:
Kushtrim is a 22-year-old male who has recently married and has become the father of a 9-month-old daughter. He lives in the village with his new family and works in construction with increased work in the summers working for another private company. 

To add more income during the year, he is usually involved in the agricultural business but has recently had to sell his cow in order to provide money for his family. Kushtrim is now requesting a loan to purchase a new cow, so that he can reduce the milk and dairy costs of his family and also start to sell the milk in his neighborhood. 

His goal is to eventually expand his farm by adding more cows to increase his business and profit. He really appreciates all the support from the lenders!

loans.use: To purchase a new cow, so that he can reduce the milk and dairy costs of his family

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has had a tailoring business in the Philippines for 13 years.

Dolores has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy supplies for her tailoring business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Nver

texts.en:
Nver is 41 years old and lives in the village, Vahagni, in the Lori region. He has a very nice large family; he lives with his wife, two school-aged children and his retired parents. Thanks to his father’s precious and useful advice, Nver has become a very skilled and clever farmer who owns a very nice large farm. He is also engaged in bee-keeping and in fish keeping. 

Nver has built a small artificial lake by himself where he breeds a fish called ‘’sazan’’ (European carp). As he says, this type of fish is greatly demanded by people and is very tasty. He sells the fish to his villagers and to fast-food centers. His farm also is rich with livestock such as cows, calves and piglets. His mother helps him to sell their farm's dairy products and also honey which is pure and very tasty.
 
Nver is asking for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams in order to buy some fish forage as during winter months he must take care of his fish properly in order to sell them in spring.

loans.use: to buy some fish forage as during winter months he must take care of his fish properly in order to sell them in spring

loans.name: Alberto Nicolas

texts.es:
Alberto tiene 20 años de edad vive en Union Libre tiene un hijo de seis meses vive con su familia en casa de sus padres en el Canton Ventanas Provincia de Los Rios.

La ventanilla se llama SAN PEDRO  esta venilla se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia Guare, perteneciente al Canton BABA, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agropecuarias (siembra de maiz y arroz).

Alberto se dedica a la siembra de maiz y arroz en pocas cantidades. El dinero lo solicita para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes para el suelo. Con el credito ha podido lograr pagar los gastos de la produccion como el transporte y la alimentacion.

Sus compras las realiza en Ventanas en Coercial Lopez.

Su metas es tener mas ingresos para poder comprar terrenos para seguir sembrando.Los desafios que enfrenta son las enfermedades como cogollera que daña los cultivos.

En los tiempos libres me gusta caminar por el campo viendo la siembra.
texts.en:
Alberto is 20 years old, is in a common law marriage, and has a six month old son.  He lives at his parents’ house in the Ventanas settlement, within the Los Rios province.

The area is called SAN PEDRO and is located in the Guare parish, part of the BABA settlement.  This area is a farming area (corn and rice).

Alberto raises corn and rice in small quantities.  He is asking for this loan to buy seeds, and fertilizer for the soil.  This loan will allow him to pay for production expenses such as transportation and feeding the soil.

He makes his purchases in the commercial areas of Lopez.

His goals are to have a greater income and be able to buy land on which to keep planting.  His challenges include freezes which damage the crops.

He likes to walk in the fields and look at the crops in his spare time.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Donna

texts.en:
Donna is a 40-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Donna has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Donna has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more items such as pants, blouses, perfumes and other dry goods.

Donna has been in this business for five years. In the future, Donna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items such as pants, blouses, perfumes and other dry goods

loans.name: Julia Pilar

texts.es:
Julia tiene 40 años de edad vive en Union Libre tiene 6 hijos con la familia en casa arrendada en el Canton Ventanas Provincia de Los Rios.

La ventanilla se llama SAN PEDRO  esta venilla se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia Guare, perteneciente al Canton BABA, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agropecuarias (siembra de maiz y arroz).

Julia se dedica a la siembra de maiz y arroz en pocas cantidades. El dinero lo solicita para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes para el suelo. Con el credito ha podido lograr pagar los gastos de la produccion como el transporte y la alimentacion.

Sus compras las realiza en Ventanas en Coercial Lopez.

Su metas es tener mas ingresos para poder comprar un finca para construir la casa para la familia.Los desafios que enfrenta son las enfermedades como cogollera que daña los cultivos.

En los tiempos libres me gusta limpiar la casa y cocinar cosas ricas para la familia.
texts.en:
Juila is 40 years old, is in a common law marriage, and has six children.  She lives in a rented house in the Ventanas settlement, within the Los Rios province.

The area is called SAN PEDRO and is located in the Guare parish, part of the BABA settlement.  This area is a farming area (corn and rice).

Julia raises corn and rice in small quantities.  She is asking for this loan to buy seeds, and fertilizer for the soil.  This loan will allow her to pay for production expenses such as transportation and feeding the soil.

She makes her purchases in the commercial areas of Lopez.

Her goals are to have a greater income and be able to buy a farm on which to build a house for her family.  Her challenges include freezes which damage the crops.

She likes to clean the house and cook delicious dishes in her spare time.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Nysret

texts.en:
Nysret is a 25-year-old single male who lives in a small village with only his mother as his father has died. Nysret is a very hard-working person who tries all possible ways to provide for and contribute to his family in order to keep them healthy and stable. His primary source of income is his employment in construction doing flooring work, but he also supplements his income working in agriculture, where he owns a cow and sells milk to a large company that makes cheese, yogurt and other milk products. 

Now, Nysret is requesting a loan to purchase another cow so he can continue to sell the milk for dairy products as he hopes to provide additional savings for his future and provide for their basic needs. Nysret hopes to get married and start a family of his own. He wants to thank all of the lenders for their support!

loans.use: To purchase another cow so he can continue to sell the milk for dairy products

loans.name: Martha Celia

texts.es:
Martha de 36 Años de edad, madre soltera con tres hijos menores de edad, los cuales están estudiando. Es originaria de la zona norte del país, se caracteriza por ser responsable, trabajadora, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfruta de la compañía de sus hijos. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar trabajo social. En la actualidad lucha para que sus hijos si pueda estudiar y ser profesionales de bien.
Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica  un pequeño comedor ubicado en su casa de habitación. Donde ofrece comida casera, jugos, gaseosas, cervezas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con la compra de productos comestibles para prepara la comida, jugos, gaseosas, platos vasos, cubiertos, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Martha agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Martha is 36 years old and a single mother with three young children who are studying. She is originally from a district in the northern part of the country. Martha is known for being responsible, hardworking, and having the desire to succeed on a personal level. In her free time, she enjoys spending time with her children. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, Martha was not able to pursue a degree. She would have liked to have studied social work. At the moment, she strives so that her children can study and become successful professionals.

Thanks to her efforts and her drive to move ahead, Martha earns her living by managing a small diner in her home. She offers home-cooked dishes, juices, sodas, and beer. Martha works at her business approximately 12 hours a day by offering her products. The purpose of this loan is to invest it as operating capital and to restock her business. She will purchase food products for preparing her dishes, juices, sodas, plates, glasses, and cutlery. In the not-so-distant future, she would like to earn more income.

Martha appreciates the assistance of the Kiva lenders who avail themselves to people who have limited resources and come from poor countries, such as Nicaragua, so that they can have a way of earn a decent living.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, juices, sodas, plates, glasses, and cutlery.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUISSEME, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 41 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Fala Sidibela, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de condiment, de l’habillement, de la restauration etc. Les femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME sont à leurs vingt deuxième prêts. 
La cliente Djeneba,  1 ère  à droite  est  la restauratrice du groupe. Dans son restaurant on y trouve du riz, de l’igname de la viande tous biens cuits. Elle compte acheter  4 sacs de riz, 8 sacs d’igname 50 kg de viande sur place. La vente de ses plats alimentaires se fait dans son petit restaurant à Massigui à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 80.000FCFA par mois. Ce bénéfice sera en partie réinvesti dans l’activité et dans les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The DJIGUISSEME group is made up of married women who average 41 years old with 6 children each, and all live in traditional extended families in a village called Fala Sidibela, in the commune of Massigui, in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They met through family, friends, and neighbors. 

They sell grains, condiments, clothing, prepared food, etc. The women of the DJIGUISSEME group are seeking their 22nd loan. 

Djeneba, the first person on the right, is the restaurant owner of the group. In her restaurant, she serves rice, yams and meat that is all cooked well. She plans on buying 4 bags of rice, 8 bags of yams and 50 kg of meat locally. She sells her dishes in her small restaurant in Massigui to male and female customers. 

She hopes to earn an average monthly income of 80,000 CFA Francs. This revenue will be reinvested in her business and help cover household expenses.

loans.use: to buy restaurant ingredients.

loans.name: Huchuy Qosqo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “HUCHUY QOSQO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Felicitas ella es conviviente y tiene 49 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de chicha.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the “HUCHUY QOSQO” communal bank, located in the Calca district, part of the Urubamba province within the Cusco department.

Felicitas is 49 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children.  She raises animals, Guinea pigs and chickens, sells them at the various fairs, and gets her children ahead through this small business.  Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell her Guinea pigs and chickens.  She is asking for this loan to buy animals and feed.

The other members sell animals, are farmers, have grocery stores, and sell chicha.

This member is grateful to those who form part of this dream and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed.

loans.name: Sevak

texts.en:
Sevak is a 34-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children who are attending school. He has worked at creating jewelry for the past 13 years. His job is based at his house. In parallel, he works in the same domain at a local company with the aim of earning a supplementary income. In addition, his wife works at a local mini market to increase the family’s income furthermore. 

Today, Sevak seeks to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase jewels and other items needed at good prices to improve his efficiency and competence at work, and therefore, increase his productivity, sales and income. Even with the two jobs that he works in and his wife’s occupation as well, Sevak shows a real need to get help, as the family’s financial situation is not satisfactory at this stage. He badly wants to keep on supporting his relatives and meet their life requirements.

loans.use: to purchase jewels and other items needed

loans.name: Edi Wilfredo

texts.es:
Edi Wilfredo agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y por el apoyo brindado, ella continua con la agricultura y la venta de  madera en la ciudad de Pilcopata. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Chacoq” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar madera.  

Edi Wilfredo tiene 25 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante. (La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Edi Wilfredo is grateful to the lenders for their support.  She continues to farm and sell lumber in the city of Pilcopata.  She has been with the “Chacoq” communal bank for several years and she needs a loan to buy lumber.

Edi Wilfredo is 25 years old and lives in Pilcopata.  She is a hardworking, enterprising person who gets ahead. (Pilcopata is the capital of the Kosñipata district, within the Paucartambo province of the Cusco department of Peru).

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Katherine Johayra

texts.es:
Katherine tiene 19 años de edad vive en Union Libre tiene un hijo con su familia en casa de sus padres en el Canton Ventanas Provincia de Los Rios.

La ventanilla se llama SAN PEDRO  esta venilla se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia Guare, perteneciente al Canton BABA, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agropecuarias (siembra de maiz y arroz).

Katherine se dedica a la siembra de maiz y arroz en pocas cantidades. El dinero lo solicita para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes para el suelo. Con el credito ha podido lograr pagar los gastos de la produccion como el transporte y la alimentacion.

Sus compras las realiza en Ventanas en Comercial Lopez.

Su metas es tener mas ingresos para poder comprar terrenos para seguir sembrando.Los desafios que enfrenta son las enfermedades como cogollera que daña los cultivos.

En los tiempos libres disfruta mucho de hacer los quehaceres domesticos.
texts.en:
Katherine is 19 years old, is in a common law marriage, and has a son.  She lives at her parents’ house in the Ventanas settlement, within the Los Rios province.

The area is called SAN PEDRO and is located in the Guare parish, part of the BABA settlement.  This area is a farming area (corn and rice).

Katherine raises corn and rice in small quantities.  She is asking for this loan to buy seeds, and fertilizer for the soil.  This loan will allow her to pay for production expenses such as transportation and feeding the soil.

She makes her purchases in the commercial areas of Lopez.

Her goals are to have a greater income and be able to buy land on which to keep planting.  Her challenges include freezes which damage the crops.

She likes to do housework in her spare time.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food stall business in the Philippines.

Elisa requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Elisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Rosarita

texts.en:
Rosarita is 55-years-old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rosarita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Rosarita has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, sugar, bread and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future, Rosarita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 51 years old and married with one kid. Delia works very hard to provide for the family.

Delia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Delia has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, snack foods and other groceries. 

In the future, Delia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Chari

texts.en:
Chari is asking for a loan because she believes that through it she will improve her business. The previous loan enabled her to save money in her farming business. Besides farming, she operates a retail shop. She is requesting a loan of 35,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, soap, cooking oil and sugar for her business.

She feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan, which to date has allowed her to maintain her level of profits to help her family cover their personal expenses.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, soap, cooking oil and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman with three children who attend school. She owns a house without electricity or running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over two years, she has operated a fruit and vegetable business, selling goods from home to her neighbors and customers. She faces a major challenge of weather conditions. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase green vegetables, fruit, tomatoes, potatoes and onions to stock her business. She decided to join Yehu to acquire loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, fruit, tomatoes, potatoes and onions to stock her business.

loans.name: Zoran

texts.en:
Zoran is 46 years old and lives in a minority community in Kosovo. He is married and the father of three children, two boys and one girl. For a long time, Zoran has been involved in agriculture to add more income to his family but he is also employed with an electrical company as his work is the main source of income while his wife is a housewife. 

As part of his work in agriculture, Zoran keeps cows and has two hectares where he plants corn and wheat. After a busy day at work and on days off, Zoran works on his land and on other people's land with his tractor, planting and harvesting crops. 

He now needs a loan to buy a seeder machine to help him to continue his business which brings a lot of profit and generates income for his family. He is also trying to save the money from this business for his family's future. His goal is to have better living conditions for his family. Zoran wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy a seeder machine to help him to continue his business

loans.name: Hernan Agapito

texts.es:
Hernán Agapito tiene 50 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos y esposa en el Caserío Piedra Herrada una zona rural del distrito de Buenos Aires , su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, es una comunidad tranquila, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon, que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica al comercio de animales menores ovejas, patos, pavos, desde hace cinco años las ventas los realiza en los caseríos anexos, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de cerdos y de esta manera seguir realizando sus ventas, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Hernán Agapito is 50 years old, and he lives with his wife and two children in the village of Piedra Herrada, a rural zone within the district of Buenos Aires. 

The people there work in agriculture, trade, and livestock.  It is a peaceful community located in the Morropón Province which lies within the region of Piura, on Peru’s northern coast. 

For five years he has worked selling small animals such as sheep, ducks, and turkeys--making his sales in the adjoining villages.   He has requested a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles for the purchase of pigs, so that he can continue making sales, generating more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase pigs for market.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Doña Maria Cristina es originaria de la ciudad de Chinandega, soltera y madre de una hija ya independiente. Tiene 39 años de edad. Inicio con su negocio desde hace 3 años con la ayuda que recibía por parte de su pareja anterior, así logro poner su negocio con esfuerzo y ganas de salir adelante. Solicita el crédito para comprar bisutería, granos básicos (arroz, azúcar, frijoles, maíz, etc.), productos varios (perfumes, cremas, talcos, etc.). Su plan futuro es tener una mini distribuidora donde pueda seguir ofreciendo mejores servicios a su clientela.
texts.en: Maria Cristina is from the city of Chinandega. She is single and she is the mother of a self-sufficient  daughter. She is 39 years old. She started her business three years ago with support she received from her previous partner. She achieved making her business with effort and a desire to get ahead. She is requesting a loan to purchase costume jewelry, staple grains (rice, sugar, beans, corn, etc.) and various beauty products  (perfumes, creams, powders, etc.) Her plan for the future is to have a mini-distributorship where she can continue to offer the best service to her customers.

loans.use: purchase costume jewelry, staple grains and various beauty products

loans.name: Narou Kadior Kahone Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe nommé Narou Kadior Kahone est composé de cinq femmes qui s’activent dans le commerce et la teinture. Elles ont acquis une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans ce domaine et comptent une clientèle régulière dans le marché. Elles achètent le tissus, soit du basin, soit un autre, les produits de teinture et commence le travail. Il peut arriver aussi qu’un client amène un habit pour se le faire teindre dans une autre couleur que l’original.
Le groupe a comme responsable, la dame Khodia, qui est mariée et mère de famille. Elle gère les petits besoins de ses enfants et appui son époux dans la dépense quotidienne de la maison. 
Elles souhaitent ouvrir une grande unité de production, voire une usine de teinture dans la localité. Elles sollicitent pour cela l’appui d’un bailleur de fond qui serait intéressé par ce domaine.
texts.en:
This group is called Narou Kadior Kahone, and is composed of five women who all work in retail and dyeing. They have over five years' experience in this field, and have a regular customer base in the market. They buy fabric (jacquard or another kind) and dye products, and then start their work. Sometimes customers also bring pieces of clothing which they ask the women to dye in a different color from the item's original color.

The head of the group is called Khodia, and she is a married mother. She provides for her children's few needs, as well as supporting her husband with the daily household expenses. The group's members want to open a large production unit in their town - in other words, a dye workshop. This is why they have asked for financial support from a lender who is interested in this area.

loans.use: to buy fabric which she will dye and resell

loans.name: Sultonaly

texts.en:
Sultonaly is a hardworking man. He is 62 years old. Sultonaly is a builder. He lives with his family in a rural area. He is a careful father of three children. His wife is housewife. Sultonaly builds houses and other kind of placements. He is very hardworking and works hard for earning a living. 

Sultonaly has a small income from his activity. He does not have money to buy coal and wood for the winter season. He lives with his family in a rural area; that’s why his living place is so cold. He is asking for a loan of 2,000 somoni to buy coal and wood. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy wood and coal for the winter season

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.es:
Victoriano agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contento por el apoyo brindado, ella sigue dedicándose a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, patos y gallinas en la ciudad de Pilcopata. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Chacoq” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más gallinas y cuyes. 

(La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Victoriano is grateful to the lenders for their support and is happy about the support.  H continues to farm and raise small animals such as Guinea pigs, ducks, and chickens in the city of Pilcopata.  He has been with the “Chacoq” communal bank for several years and needs a loan to buy more chickens and Guinea pigs.

(Pilcopata is the capital of the Kosñipata district, within the Paucartambo province of the Cusco department of Peru).

loans.use: to buy Guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: El Trebol Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socios luchadores uno de ellos es José hombre de 38 años, acompañado, con dos hijos, su negocio es una panadería desde hace 5 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 1 año. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de materia prima como harina, levadura, manteca, azúcar, margarina, mantequilla, borona, jalea, leña, bolsas. Silvia mujer de 46 años su negocio es zapatería y  Norlan tiene 28 años su negocio es la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
This group consists of three determined members. One of them is José. He is 38 years old, in a relationship, and has two children. His business is a bakery that he has managed for five years. José has been a client of ADIM for one year. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy supplies such as flour, yeast, shortening, sugar, margarine, butter, corn, jelly, firewood, and bags.

Silvia is a 46-year-old woman who has a shoemaking business. Norlan is 28 years old and has a business of selling clothes.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, shortening, sugar, margarine, butter, corn, jelly, firewood, and bags.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik lives with her husband in Noravan village and they are farmers. They keep cows, sheep, pigs and chickens as their main source of income. They own a plot of land near their house that is used to grow different vegetables. All the income  is used to meet the needs of their family. 

Hasmik and her husband do their very best to support themselves with their farming business. Hasmik has applied for this loan of 750 USD to enlarge their farm. With the loan, she will be able to purchase seeds and fuel to cultivate the land. Hasmik will be able to harvest more in the spring. 

Since this is the first loan that Hasmik has applied for, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, purchase fuel for land cultivation and hire workers to harvest the crops.

loans.name: Rasmiya

texts.en: Rasmiya is from Iraq. She is 42-years-old, married and has 2 children.  Rasmiya helps her husband with providing income for the family. Rasmiya is a tailor and works from home.  She has much experience in tailoring women's and children's outfits and has been practicing in this profession since 2000. Rasmiya is well-known in the neighborhood and has an excellent reputation.  Rasmiya is requesting a loan of 1,800 USD.  She will use this loan to buy a new sewing machine and a motor generator. She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits so she may provide a better income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and a motor generator

loans.name: Edinson David

texts.es:
Edinson tiene 22 años de edad es soltero tiene no tiene hijos vive con su familia en casa de sus padres en el Canton Ventanas Provincia de Los Rios.

La ventanilla se llama SAN PEDRO  esta venilla se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia Guare, perteneciente al Canton BABA, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agropecuarias (siembra de maiz y arroz).

Edinson se dedica a la siembra de maiz y arroz en pocas cantidades. El dinero lo solicita para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes para el suelo. Con el credito ha podido lograr pagar los gastos de la produccion como el transporte y la alimentacion.

Sus compras las realiza en Ventanas en Comercial Lopez.

Su metas es tener mas ingresos para poder comprar terrenos para seguir sembrando y construir una casa.Los desafios que enfrenta son las enfermedades como cogollera que daña los cultivos.

En los tiempos libres me gusta salir a bailar con los amigos y las amigas en la discoteca.
texts.en:
Edinson is 22 years old, single, and has no children.  He lives at his parents’ house in the Ventanas settlement, within the Los Rios province.

The area is called SAN PEDRO and is located in the Guare parish, part of the BABA settlement.  This area is a farming area (corn and rice).

Edinson raises corn and rice in small quantities.  He is asking for this loan to buy seeds, compost, and fertilizer for the soil.  This loan will allow him to pay for production expenses such as transportation and feeding the soil.

He makes his purchases in the commercial areas of Lopez.

His goals are to have a greater income and be able to buy land on which to keep planting and build a house.  His challenges include freezes which damage the crops.

He likes to go out dancing at the discotheque with his friends in his spare time.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Darrel

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Darrel works hard to support her family.

She has a cafeteria business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Darrel is borrowing 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy coffee, sugar and utensils for her cafeteria business.

Darrel has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar and utensils.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Elvira works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Elvira is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

Elvira has sustained her business through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Lyne

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Lyne. She is a nurse by profession. When Lyne is not at the hospital, she spends her days running her own business which deals in the sale of coca-cola products like Fanta, Sprite and Coca-Cola.  Lyne has requested a Kiva loan so that she can increase the stock levels at her shop.  This will enable her to grow her business and earn more profits.

Lyne has  been running her business for five years with the help of her sister. The business helps her to provide for her family and gives her additional income. She enjoys owning her business because it put her in a position where she can make her own decisions. 

Lyne is hopeful that the loan she has applied for will help her to earn more profits and improve her standards of living by growing her business.

loans.use: To order more drinks so that she can increase her stock levels and make more sells

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more charcoal and oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more coal for her business.

loans.name: Celia Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Celia habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su familia, toda su vida  la ha dedicado a la agricultura gracias al apoyo de su esposo, actualmente tiene cosecha de piña y requiere de capital para darle mantenimiento, el credito lo solicita para la compra de Triple, Urea, Completo, fertilizantes etc. ella se muestra muy agradecida con el apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le han brindado en estos años.
texts.en: Celia lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with her family. She has worked in agriculture her whole life and currently harvests pineapples thanks to her husband's support. To maintain the harvest capital is required and the requested loan will be used to purchase urea and other fertilizers. She is very grateful for the help Kiva and Afodenic have given her these past few years.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Delma

texts.es:
Delma es un mujer muy trabajadora vive con su esposo y su hijo menor en un cuarto que le concedieron sus padres en la zona de Alto Chijini Final Ricardo Bustamante ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz. La Sra. Delma realiza la actividad de venta de productos de ferreteria en una de las principales ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, como ser candados, cortadoras de cesped, taladros, cascos de seguridad, cerruchos, cierras mecanicas, juego de desarmadores, cortadora de tubos, etc etc.  El esposo es electricista desempeña funciones como encargado de mantenimiento en un hospital. La Sra. Delma necesita el credito para la compra de mas mercaderia por las fiestas de fin de año y asi formar un buen capital de trabajo y poder volverse en este caso vendedora mayorista y no asi minorista y asi poder hacer frente los gastos que tiene  y que no afecten a su hogar.

El sueño de La Sra. Delma poder tener mayores ingresos en base al sacrificio que hace su familia, y poder tener una vejez tranquila, espera  contar con un patrimonio estable para su vejez que le permita vivir mejorar su calidad de vida como para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Delma is a very hardworking woman. She lives with her husband and young son in a room given by his parents. They live in the Alto Chijini Final Ricardo Bustamante area in the city of La Paz. Delma sells hardware products at one of the main markets in the city of El Alto. She sells items like locks, lawn mowers, drills, hard hats, hand saws and mechanical saws, wrenches, tube cutting machines and other products. Her husband is an electrician who works as a maintenance man at a hospital. Delma needs the loan in order to purchase more merchandise for the end of the year holidays. This will also form good working capital. She can return to being a wholesale vendor and not a retail vendor so that she can deal with her expenses and not affect her household. 

Delma's dream is to be have a higher income due to the sacrifice her family has made and to have a peaceful old age. She hopes to have stable assets for her old age that will allow her to have a better quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: purchase of locks, drills, saws, etc.., to continue her business of selling hardware and improve her income.

loans.name: Henrry Jimmy

texts.es: Henrry continúa viviendo en la hermosa ciudad de Pilcopata y donde sigue dedicándose a la agricultura y la venta de madera, él se siente contento por el apoyo brindado y desea continuar participando en este proyecto entonces en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más madera. (La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en: Henrry is still living in the lovely city of Pilcopata, where he continues to make a living from agriculture and the sale of wood. He feels happy with the support given to him and he wishes to continue participating in this project. On this occasion he needs a loan in order to purchase more wood. (The city of Pilcopata is the capital of Kosñipata district, in the province of Paucartambo, in the department of Cusco, Peru).

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KOTOGNONTALA, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 50 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Fala Sidibela, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce  de céréales, de condiments, de l’habillement, du savon et de la restauration. Les femmes du groupe KOTOGNONTALA sont à leur premier prêt.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
La cliente Kadia, la personne au milieu  est vendeuse de condiments. Elle compte acheter 4  seaux de pâte d’arachide, 1 panier de poivron, 2 cartons de  cube maggi et du sel de cuisine. La vente se fait  au marché et aussi à la maison à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20.000FCFA par mois. Ce bénéfice sera en partie réinvesti dans l’activité et les dépenses  de la famille.
texts.en:
The KOTOGNONTALA group is made up of married women who average 50 years old with 4 children each, and all live in traditional extended families in a village called Fala Sidibela, in the commune of Massigui, in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They met through family, friends, and neighbors. 

They sell grains, condiments, clothing, soap and prepared food. The women of the KOTOGNONTALA group are seeking their first loan. 

Kadia, in the middle of the photo, sells condiments. She plans on buying 4 buckets of peanut butter, 1 package of pepper, 2 boxes of maggi cubes and kitchen salt. She sells her products at the market and from home to male and female customers. 

She hopes to earn an average monthly income of 20,000 CFA Francs. This revenue will be partly reinvested in the business and partly used to cover household expenses.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Madame ADAMA est une brave femme qui évolue dans la commercialisation de tissus et cosmétique. Elle est mariée et mère de famille qui aide son mari dans la charges des dépenses quotidiennes e t les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.  Elle a une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans cette activité. Etant à son  5ème prêt elle sollicite ce dernier pour  acheter et revendre des produits alimentaires comme le riz, l’huile, le sucre, le savon, lait etc.……. Elle n’a pas d’heure fixe de travail. ADAMA va diversifier avec l’aide de l’institution les produits et augmenter ses revenus. A l’avenir il souhaite acquérir d’un autre local avec ses propres moyens.
texts.en:
Adama is an honest woman who sells fabrics and cosmetics. She is married with children and helps her husband cover their daily expenses and school fees for their children. 

She has more than 5 years of experience in this domain. This is her 5th loan, which she is seeking in order to buy and resell food products like rice, oil, sugar, soap, milk, etc. She does not have set work hours. 

Adama will use the aid from the institution to diversify the products she offers and to increase her income. In the future, she hopes to acquire another location with her own means.

loans.use: to buy food and cosmetics.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Osacar es un hombre muy trabajador; vive con su señora señora esposa y su hijo menor en un cuarto en anticredico en la zona de la Buenos Aires ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz. Oscar desempeña funciones en la unidad administrativa de de una entidad pública como auxiliar de suministros.  La esposa trabaja como regente farmaceutica en una Farmacia,con una carga horaira de 8 horas.
Oscar necesita el credito para hacer el pago de gasto medicos de su señora madre que fue hospitalizada de emergencia por una caida accidental y asi poder hacer frente en estos dichos gastos y que no afecten a su hogar.

El sueño de Oscar poder tener mayores ingresos en base al sacrificio que hace su familia, y poder tener una vejez tranquila, espera  contar con un salario de vejez que le permita vivir mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Oscar is a hardworking man.  He lives with his wife and son in an antichresis apartment in the Buenos Aires zone of the city of La Paz.  Oscar works as a manager for a public entity which is an auxiliary supplier.  His wife works eight hours a day as a pharmaceutical regent.

Oscar needs a loan to make a medical payment for his mother who was hospitalized due to an accidental fall.  He wants to pay these expenses without affecting his household.

Oscar’s dream is to have a greater income through his sacrifice and be able to have a relaxed old age.  He hopes to be able to count on an old age salary that will allow him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to pay medical expenses for his mother.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is 34-years-old and she lives in Vanadzor in the Lori region. Gayane is married and she has three school-aged daughters. She has the specialty of a nurse, but she has never worked and it has already been ten years that she has been engaged in the trading business. On a rented stall, she sells curtains, covers and different fabrics.  During these years, she has already managed to attract many customers who have become her loyal customers. Gayane is very pleasant, cute and patient in her business.  She even has a sewing machine and she herself sews and helps her customers to design the curtains or cover for their room, which they choose at her stall. She brings her stall’s products from the Yerevan wholesale markets once a month. Her daughters also help her very much and sometimes they also give some advice and ideas with the design of curtains.

She asks for a loan of 1,100,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a lot of new assortment of fabrics for her business and to increase her income from it as well.

loans.use: to buy a lot of new assortment of fabrics for her business.

loans.name: Geofry

texts.en:
Geofry is 45 years old.  He is married to Pamela and he supports a family of eight.  

He is a small-scale maize farmer in Kap in Nandi County and is served by KADET’s Kapsabet Branch.  He has been in this business for the last three years and, from this business, he earns a monthly income of 5,000 KES.  He has taken a loan of 24,500 KES, which he will use to purchase chicks for his new poultry farming business.  With the anticipated profits, he will expand his business.

His dream is to be a successful farmer and give the best education to his children.

loans.use: to purchase chicks.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is a 36-year-old lady from Kakamega  county and is married to Kennedy.  Her husband is in formal employment in the same region.  They are blessed with four children aged 17, 14, 13 and five years old.


She sells cereal and has been in this business for 15 years.  Her monthly income is 20,000 KES.  She requests this third loan with Vision Fund Kenya,  to expand her current business. 

Tabitha plans to use the anticipated profits to pay fees for her children and invest in the business. Her dream is to give her children the best education possible and to purchase more cereal.

loans.use: to buy cereal for resale.

loans.name: Mwanasiye

texts.en:
Mwanasiye is a married woman with four children; two children are in school and two are adults. She owns a house without electricity or running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over two years, she has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business.  She sells from home to her neighbors and other customers. She faces a major challenge of weather conditions. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

She will use the 10,000 KES to purchase green vegetables, fruit, tomatoes, potatoes and onions to stock her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, fruit, tomatoes, potatoes and onions to stock her business.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
Nicolás tiene 40 años de edad, vive junto a esposa en el distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de café de la variedad catimor, desde hace seis años, también cultiva maíz, frejol y yucas, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para sus cultivos y de esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
