Nicolás is 40 years old, and he lives with his wife in the district of Pomahuaca, a community where the people work in agriculture, trade, and cattle raising.  It is located about two hours from the city of Jaén, which lies within Cajamarca Region in Peru’s northern sierra.  

He works in farming, especially the Catimor variety of coffee, which he has been cultivating for six years. He also grows corn, beans, and yucca.
 
He has requested a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to purchase fertilizer for his crops, so that he will have a better production to offer his customers, and generate more income for his family

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
La Sra. Liliana es una Mujer muy trabajadora vive en casa de sus suegros en la zona de Pampahasi ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.  Se dedica principalmente al servicio de venta de comida internacional y venta de pastas crudas y postres, el trabajo tambien lo hace a pedido de los clientes. La cliente esta divorciada y su ex-esposo la dejo con sus dos hijos. La Sra Liliana necesita el credito para hacer la compra de materia prima (arroz, condimentos, carnes, etc.)y de esta manera poder tener mayores ingresos por las fiestas de fin de año y asi poder hacer frente a los gastos que tiene en su hogar.

El sueño de la Sra Liliana es poder tener mayores ingresos en base al sacrificio que hace su familia, y poder tener una vejez tranquila, espera  contar con un salario de vejez que le permita vivir mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Liliana is a very hardworking woman who lives with her in-laws in the Pampahasi area of La Paz.  She sells international food and raw pasta and desserts.  She also takes customer orders.  She is divorced and her ex-husband left her with the children.  Liliana needs a loan to buy ingredients (rice, condiments, meats, etc.) and in this way increase her income over the end of year festivals and cover the household expenses.

Liliana’s dream is to be able to increase her income through her family’s sacrifice and to be able to have a relaxed old age.  She hopes to be able to have good salary so she can improve her quality of life in her old age.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Bitty Kasse

texts.fr: Madame BITTY KASSE est une femme mariée qui habite dans le quartier ou se situe le Guichet. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des draps et bijoux et a une expérience de plus de 10ans dans cette activité. Elle n’a pas fixé son horaire de travail car elle passe toute la journée dehors pour faire ses activités. Elle aide son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. BITTY  sollicite ce prêt d’un montant de 300.000F pour acheter et revendre des draps et bijoux. A l’avenir elle souhaite avec l’aide de l’institution,  diversifier ses produits afin de pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et  épargner de l’argent. Ainsi elle pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et ouvrir une boutique d’habits.
texts.en:
Bitty Kasse is a married woman who lives in the same neighborhood as the local branch office. She sells sheets and jewelry, and has more than 10 years of experience in this domain. She does not have set work hours, as she spends all day outside in order to carry out her business. She helps her husband cover daily family expenses and their children's school fees. 

Bitty is seeking a 300,000 F loan in order to buy and resell sheets and jewelry. In the future, she hopes to use the aid from the institution to diversify the products she offers in order to increase her revenue and save some money. This would allow her to improve living conditions for her family and to open up a clothing store.

loans.use: to buy and sell sheets and jewelry.

loans.name: Thianar

texts.fr: Elle s’appelle THIANAR, il est marié et père de famille. Il est à son 3ème prêt et évolue dans l’artisanat. Il a une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans cette activité et à besoin de ce montant  pour acheter des tissus et des garnitures pour satisfaire ses commandes. Il a comme charge la nourriture et le loyer de son atelier. Il commence sa journée à 8h pour la finir à 20h.  Il envisage d’ouvrir un autre atelier et acheter un véhicule de transport pour  mieux épargner et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
His name is Thianar, and he is married with children. He is seeking his 3rd loan, and works as an artisan. He has more than 10 years of experience in this business, and is in need of the loan in order to buy the fabric and embellishments necessary to complete his orders. 

His expenses include food and the rent for his workshop. He begins his days at 8 a.m., and finishes at 8 p.m. He dreams of opening another workshop and buying a vehicle in order to save more money and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabric and embellishments in order to complete his orders.

loans.name: Juntos Podemos Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “JUNTOS PODEMOS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hilda ella es casada y tiene 41 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de librería, la socia vende útiles de escritorio como cuadernos,libros,lapiceros y borradores, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,la socia también se dedica al negocio de cosmetóloga ella realiza cortes de cabello, tintes entre otros, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de librería. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar libros, cuadernos y lapiceros.

La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo despues la foto porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Hilda is 41 years old, married, and has two children.  She works at a bookstore and sells school supplies such as notebooks, books, pencils, and erasers.  She works from 8:00 am to 10:00 pm and also works as a cosmetologist, doing haircuts, tints, and other things.  She has been doing this for several years and things are going well.  Her dream is to expand her bookstore business and she is asking for this loan to buy books, notebooks, and pencils.

The member whose photo is stuck to the group photo took it later because she had work commitments.

The other members sell arts and crafts, vegetables, have grocery stores or bookstores.

This member is grateful to those who form part of this dream and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Johanna Lucila

texts.es:
Johanna tiene 32 años de edad es casada tiene tres hijos con la familia en casa arrendada en el Canton Ventanas Provincia de Los Rios.

La ventanilla se llama SAN PEDRO  esta venilla se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia Guare, perteneciente al Canton BABA, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agropecuarias (siembra de maiz y arroz).

Johanna se dedica a la siembra de maiz y arroz en pocas cantidades. El dinero lo solicita para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes para el suelo. Con el credito ha podido lograr pagar los gastos de la produccion como el transporte y la alimentacion.

Sus compras las realiza en Ventanas en Comercial Lopez.

Su metas es tener mas ingresos para poder comprar una finca para seguir sembrando.Los desafios que enfrenta son las enfermedades como cogollera que daña los cultivos.

En los tiempos libres me gusta ver television.
texts.en:
Johanna is 32 years old. She is married and she has three children. The family lives in a leased house in the Ventanas settlement located in the Los Rios province. 

The area is called SAN PEDRO and is located in the Guare parish, part of the BABA settlement. This area is a farming area (corn and rice).

Joanna grows corn and rice in small quantities. The money she is requesting is for purchasing seeds and fertilizers for the soil. With the loan, she could pay the production expenses like transportation and feeding. 

She makes her purchases in Ventanas at the Lopez commercial area. 

Her goals are to have a greater income and be able to buy land on which to keep planting. Her challenges include freezes which damage the crops.
In her free time, she likes to watch television.

loans.use: purchase farming supplies.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is from Agarak village.  He lives with his parents, wife and three children who are 13 years, 8 years and one year old.

Karen is the only breadwinner in the family as his parents are retired and his wife takes care of the household and the kids. The main source of income comes from agriculture and farming activities that Karen is involved in.  He keeps two cows and owns a big orchard.  He grows different types of fruit including peaches, apricots, cherries and apples as well as nuts and sells it at nearby markets.  Karen does his best to sustain his family's living. 

Karen has now applied to SEF for a loan of $2,700 to purchase a cow and forage to feed the livestock.  Previously, Karen took a loan from a local financial institution but; unfortunately, he was not able to repay it.  However, thanks to recent hard work, he was able to run the agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments.  So, Karen has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en: Anabel is a married woman from the community of Cortes, Bohol. She has four children between the ages of five to thirteen. She has been operating a Sari-sari store selling basic household goods like sugar, cooking oil, canned goods, salt, snacks and seasoning. She would like to replenish her stock of supplies but she lacks sufficient capital. She is asking for a loan to buy snacks, chips, canned goods, candies, shampoo, coffee and seasoning. With enough stock for her store, she will be assured of daily profit that will benefit her children in terms of food and school fees. In the future, Anabel dreams of expanding her business and buying more affordable items that she can resell.

loans.use: to buy snacks, chips, canned goods, candies, shampoo, coffee and seasoning.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 68-year-old lady from Vihiga County, married to Silas. Their children are all grown, except for two who are aged 15 and 20 years. Ruth is in business selling clothes, a business she has done for the past eight years. She earns an average income of KES 5,000.

She is taking a loan from VisionFund Kenya, worth KES 10,000. She will use it to buy bales of clothes. The profits thereafter will be used to construct a good stall for selling her clothes. Her dream is to give her family the best ever.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Araceli Francisca

texts.es:
Araceli Francisca tiene 38 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Lagunas, una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus bosques verdes, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de de ropa para damas y niños desde hace dos años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de de ropa para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Araceli Francisca, 38, lives with her husband and children in the district of Lagunas, a community known for its green forests. The people work in agriculture, business and livestock. It’s located in the province of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Peru.

She has been selling women’s and children’s clothing for two years. Her business is located in her house. 

She is requesting a loan of 2,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to purchase clothing to stock her business so that she can generate a better income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for women, men and children.

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: Monsieur CHEIKH  est un homme qui habite aux environs du guichet. II travaille dans n institution de services  téléphoniques comme les TIGO ET ORANGE. Il prend en charges les dépenses quotidiennes  et les frais  de  scolarité e se enfants. Il commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 18h. Il a juste besoin de ce montant pour  acheter des cartes de crédit destinées à la vente. Il souhaite diversifier les produits et services afin de pouvoir épargner  de l’argent. Il envisage aussi ouvrir un point de service tigo.
texts.en: Cheikh is a man who lives near the local branch office. He works in a telephone services establishment like Tigo and Orange. He is responsible for his daily expenses and his children's schooling fees. His days begin at 8 a.m. and end at 6 p.m. He needs this loan in order to buy credit cards that he intends to sell. He hopes to diversify the products and services that he offers in order to save up some money. He dreams of opening up a Tigo service point.

loans.use: to buy credit cards that he will sell.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
Aurora tiene 30 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Cañarís, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Ferreñafe, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de café en su terreno ubicado cerca a su domicilio, realizando esta actividad desde hace 10 años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 501 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de café y de esta manera ofrecerlo a un mejor precio a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Aurora is 30 years old and lives with her husband in the district of Cañaris, a community devoted to agriculture. livestock, and commerce. It's located in the province of Ferreñafe in the Lambayeque region of Peru's northern coast. She works in agriculture, specifically coffee growing in her plot of land nearby her residence. For 10 years she's been doing this, and has requested a loan of 2,501 nuevos soles to purchase fertilizer to maintain her coffee plantation and thus offer a better price to her customers and earn more income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for growing coffee.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is an 18-year-old single young man from Deir Elbalah city. He lives with his family in a simple house. Ibrahim's father works as an employee in a local firm and he earns a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Ibrahim studies law, and he would like to finish his studies and find a job as a lawyer, and help his family with part of the family's expenses. Ibrahim dreams to take a higher degree in the future.

Ibrahim took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Ibrahim will be able to do his homework and write reports easily.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en:
Hovhannes is 40 years old, and he lives in the village of Pambak in the Lori region. He is married, and he has two sons, both of them still school-aged. His elder son is a very successful wrestler, and he has taken part in many competitions, taking first place. Hovhannes hopes that in future his son will continue his sports career and become a powerful and famous wrestler. Hovhannes’s wife does not work, and she takes care of their sons. 

Hovhannes is a skilled farmer, and it is also thanks to his first Kiva loan, which supported him and allowed him to buy several cows. He is greatly pleased to have such help, since it increased his family income and reduced their financial problems, both in his family and in his farm. Now in his farm he has two calves, four cows, and two piglets. As he used to, he sells cheese, butter, milk, and meat from his farm. His parents help him in his farming activities. This year the hay that Hovhannes always gathers (which he uses as an animal fodder) from his own plot of land is not enough for the winter period.

He asks for a loan of 300 Armenian drams in order to buy animal fodder and to have enough quantity of it during winter.

loans.use: to buy animal fodder and to have enough quantity of it during winter

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
This young and beautiful lady lives in Vanadzor, in the Lori region. She is 26 years old. Ani is already married and she lives with her husband and mother-in-law. 

Ani has graduated from the History faculty at the Vanadzor State Pedagogical University, and since graduation she has been engaged in pedagogical activities. She is a teacher of Armenian History at the local school. Her pupils and colleagues mention that she is very clever, and is a patient and kind person, who always makes her lessons interesting, attractive and informative. 

As she says, the history of Armenian people is important for each person to learn and to be aware of its long and severe history, during which Armenian generation managed to stay alive and to adhere to their faith and homeland. She also gives paid private courses of Armenian history for the pupils, who are going to pass entrance examinations.

Ani asks a loan of 400,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a computer and some necessary professional literature.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some necessary professional literature for her occupation.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase his capital and buy lots of cases of mass-produced beer and lemonade to resell in order to earn more money.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more blouses, slippers, chains, and trousers.

loans.name: Nasser

texts.en:
Nasser is a 29-year-old married man with children, who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. His educational background is a bachelors degree. 

Due to a lack of careers in companies, he drives a taxi where he earns a low daily income, which is not enough to provide for his family`s expenses. He is always looking to develop the skills of his children in their studies. So, he is requesting a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to buy a computer to use for developing the skills of his children in their studies. He thinks this loan will help him to improve the quality of his services. He hopes to own a house.

loans.use: to buy a computer to use for developing the skills of his children in their studies.

loans.name: Aidana

texts.en:
Aidana is a freshman in the Economics Program. This is her story:

I am from northern Kyrgyzstan, and did not attend a very good high school. The teachers are not paid well, and not motivated to teach. In 2012, I learned about a new program at AUCA called the New Generation Academy. The purpose of NGA is to prepare talented students for university. I was selected in the first group, and spent last year in the program studying English, Math, Computers, History, and Science.

Last year was an incredible experience for me, because I was with great teachers and students, and we all helped each other to succeed. I am now planning to study economics, because I want to understand more about why my country is poor, and how I can help it to grow. 

I really hope to be able to travel in the future and see other countries. There are many students at AUCA who get to travel on different programs, and I hope to apply and be accepted. I am also participating in many volunteer activities with student groups at AUCA, and I try to help as many people as I can.

loans.use: to pay for higher education costs.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Humberto es un hombre muy trabajador; vive con su pareja en la zona de Achachicala  ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.  Se dedica principalmente a la atencion de cajas en un supermercado y estudiar por las noches para su mejor superacion academica y asi poder conseguir un trabajo mas rentable para su mejorar ingresos y poder mntener su familia.  La esposa trabaja como regente farmaceutica En la misma zona todo el dia a partir de las 8:30 de la manana hasta las 7:00 de la noche.
El Sr. Humberto  necesita el credito para pagar los gastos de sus estudios superiores de computación y asi mejorar academicamente y poder acceder a un mejor cargo o empleo y asi poder tener mayores ingresos y asi poder hacer frente a los gastos que tiene en su hogar.

El sueño de Humberto es poder tener mayores ingresos en base al sacrificio que hace su familia, y poder tener una vejez tranquila, espera  contar con un salario de vejez que le permita vivir mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Humberto is a very hard-working man. He lives with his partner in the zone of Achachicala, which is located in the city of La Paz. He spends most of his time operating cash registers in a supermarket. He studies at night in order to advance academically and thereby obtain a more profitable job so his earnings increase and so he will be able to look after his family. His wife works as a pharmacist in charge in the same area. She works all day from 8:30am to 7:00pm.

Humberto needs the loan in order to pay the expenses for his computing studies so he can advance academically and be able to apply for a better role or job, have greater earnings, and deal with the household expenses.

Humberto’s dream is to be able to have greater earnings because of the sacrifice his family is making, and be able to have a peaceful old age. He hopes to rely on a pension which will allow him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to pay enrolment fees so he can continue with his computing studies

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto tiene 58 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el caserío San Lorenzo una zona rural que pertenece a Pucará, es una comunidad que se caracteriza por su clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente cultivo de piña desde hace ocho años, también cría ganado vacuno, son una familia unida que se esfuerza, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para su cultivo de piña y de esta manera mejorar su producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Edilberto is 58 years old and lives with his wife in the small village of San Lorenzo, a rural area that belongs to Pucará. It’s a community known for its hot climate. The people in his community work in agriculture, business and livestock. It’s located in the province of Jaén, in the Cajamarca region, in the northern highlands of Peru.

He works in agriculture, specifically in pineapple cultivation. He has been doing this for eight years, he also raises cattle. They are a united family that strives. 

He has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to purchase fertilizer for his pineapple crop so that he can improve his production to offer to his clients generating higher income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to cultivate pineapples.

loans.name: Tessa

texts.en: Tessa is married to a government employee and she sells grocery items in her general store to make a living.  She has been doing this for more than four years and she earns well for the family. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to expand her business to have a better source of income for the family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contento por el apoyo brindado y desea seguir participando en este proyecto pues le ayudo a incrementar el capital del negocio, él continua con la fabricación de muebles de madera como por ejemplo roperos, sillas, mesas, puertas y otras cosas más,  él tiene un taller donde elaborar sus muebles y está implementado básicamente con herramientas y algunas maquinas. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Chacoq” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como madera, clavos, cola de carpintero y otras cosas más. 

Él tiene 39 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante. (La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Daniel thanks the investors for the loan and he feels happy with the support given to him. He wishes to continue participating in this project as it helped him to increase his business capital. He is still making wooden furniture, such as wardrobes, chairs, tables, and doors. He has a workshop where he makes his furniture; it is equipped simply with tools and some machines. He has belonged to the communal bank “Chacoq” for several years, and on this occasion he needs the loan in order to purchase materials for work, such as wood, nails, and carpenter’s glue.

He is 39 years old and lives in the city of Pilcopata. He is a hard-working and enterprising person who gets ahead in life. (The city of Pilcopata is the capital of Kosñipata district, which is located in the province of Paucartambo, in the department of Cusco, Peru).

loans.use: to buy materials for work, such as wood, nails, glue and more.

loans.name: Agua Buena Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “AGUA BUENA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mery ella es casada, tiene 38 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a trabajar en un salón de belleza como cosmetóloga, la socia realiza cortes de cabello, tintes, laceados entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo trabajando el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia a la vez tiene su negocio de tienda de abarrotes siendo su hija quien le ayuda con el negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la construcción de su casa.

La socia que sale adjunta a la foto pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de imprenta, negocio de venta de artesanías, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de pasto.
 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Agua Buena” (“Good Water”) communal bank. This bank is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

Member Mery is married. She is 38 years old and has four children. She works in a beauty salon as a cosmetician. She cuts hair, does hair colouring, up-dos, etc. The member has been working there for a while and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts into her work every day. She also has her own grocery store, which her daughter helps her with. She wishes to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family.

She is requesting the loan for building her house.

The member whose photo is attached to the group photo asked permission to come late to the meeting due to work commitments.

The other members make a living from various businesses: printing, selling crafts, a grocery store, and selling animal feed.

The member thanks those who are part of her dream through this lending site and is committed to making her repayments on time.

loans.use: to build her house

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado y desea seguir participando en este proyecto, ella continua dedicándose a la agricultura y con la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Chacoq” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más cuyes. (La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en: Juana is happy because of the help she has received and she wants to keep participating in this project.  She is still working in agriculture and raising small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens.  She has belonged to the Chacoq Communal Bank for several years and this time she needs a loan to buy more guinea pigs.  (The city of Pilcopata is the capital of the district of Kosñipata in the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco, Peru.)

loans.use: to buy more guinea pigs.

loans.name: Santa Elena Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SANTA ELENA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Quillabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de la Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gregoria ella es soltera y tiene 64 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche y aceite, la socia tiene un puesto en el mercado que es una tienda de abarrotes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 1 año en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de agricultura.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Santa Elena communal bank, which is located in the district of Quillabamba, Convención province, Cusco department.

Gregoria, 64, is single and has two children. She works at her small grocery store and sells basic necessity products such as rice, sugar, milk, and cooking oil. She has a stand at the market for groceries. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. and has one year of experience in this business, which is going very well. Her dream is to grow her grocery store business. She is requesting this loan to buy milk, sugar, cooking oil, and rice.

The other members work in businesses selling animals, selling vegetables, running a grocery store, and farming.

Gregoria is grateful to those who form a part of this dream with this help and she promises to make the established monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, cooking oil, and rice.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 28 years old and married. She supports a family of four children, whose ages range between 2 and 12 years. She is a small-scale farmer in Nandi County. She also runs a general goods kiosk, which has been her income-generating business for the past three years. She earns an average monthly profit of KES 14,500.

She has borrowed a loan of KES 30,000. With this loan she intends to purchase farm inputs and pay for tilling of her farm. She also plans to use some of the money to purchase more stock for her retail kiosk. She anticipates getting profits, which she will use to expand her business by planting a greater variety of crops and increasing her farm acreage under cultivation.

Stella hopes to improve her living standard and be financially stable. She also hopes to save money, to enable her to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, pay for tilling the land, and buy stock for her retail goods kiosk

loans.name: Norma Gladys

texts.es:
Norma tiene 59 años de edad es Viuda tiene 7 hijos  vive sola Canton Ventanas Provincia de Los Rios.

La ventanilla se llama SAN PEDRO  esta venilla se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia Guare, perteneciente al Canton BABA, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agropecuarias (siembra de maiz y arroz).

Norma se dedica a la siembra de maiz y arroz en pocas cantidades. El dinero lo solicita para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes para el suelo. Con el credito ha podido lograr pagar los gastos de la produccion como el transporte y la alimentacion.

Sus compras las realiza en Ventanas en Comercial Lopez.

Su metas es tener mas dinero para coprar un carro.Los desafios que enfrenta son las enfermedades como cogollera que daña los cultivos.

En los tiempos libres me gusta ver television
texts.en:
Norma is 59 years old; she is a widow with seven children who lives alone in the Ventanas Canton of the province of Los Rios. 

Her communal bank is called San Pedro and it is located in the parish of Guare, which belongs to the canton of Baba.  This communal bank deals with farmwork (planting corn and rice).

Norma grows corn and rice in small quantities.  She is requesting this money to buy seed, manure, and fertilizers for the soil.  With her loan she was able to cover her production expenses, such as transportation and food. 

She does her buying in Ventanas at Comercial Lopez. 

Her goal is to have more money to buy a car.  The challenges she faces are pests, such as armyworms, which damage her crops.  

In my free time I like to watch television.

loans.use: seed, manure, and fertilizers for the soil

loans.name: Rocio Mireya

texts.es:
Rocio tiene 32 años de edad vive en Union Libre tiene tres hijos vive con su familia en el Canton Ventanas Provincia de Los Rios.

La ventanilla se llama SAN PEDRO  esta venilla se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia Guare, perteneciente al Canton BABA, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agropecuarias (siembra de maiz y arroz).

Rocio se dedica a la siembra de maiz y arroz en pocas cantidades. El dinero lo solicita para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes para el suelo. Con el credito ha podido lograr pagar los gastos de la produccion como el transporte y la alimentacion.

Sus compras las realiza en Ventanas en Comercial Lopez.

Su metas es tener mas ingresos para poder comprar terrenos para seguir sembrando.Los desafios que enfrenta son las enfermedades como cogollera que daña los cultivos.

En los tiempos libres me gusta ver television con la familia.
texts.en:
Rocio is 32 years old.  She has a partner and three children and she lives with her family in the Ventanas Canton of the province of Los Rios. 

Her communal bank is called San Pedro and it is located in the parish of Guare, which belongs to the canton of Baba.  This communal bank deals with agricultural work (planting corn and rice). 

Rocio grows corn and rice in small quantities.  The money she is requesting is to buy seed, manure, and fertilizers for the soil.  With her loan she was able to cover her production costs, such as transportation and food.  

She does her buying in Ventanas at Comercial Lopez. 

Her goal is to have more income so she can buy land to keep planting.  The challenges she faces are pests, such as armyworms, which damage her crops.  


In my free time I like to watch television with my family.

loans.use: to buy seed, manure, and fertilizers for the soil

loans.name: Arfenia

texts.en:
Arfenia is from Vardanidzor village, in Syuniq region. She lives with her husband and 17-year-old son. Her husband is a teacher at a local village school, with many years of experience. Arfenia has been running a farm for many years. She owns an orchard where she grows different kinds of fruit (apricot, peach, cherry, apple, plum) and nuts. Arfenia also keeps a cow. She works hard, to gather a good agricultural harvest and help her husband to cover their family's costs.

Realizing the importance of agricultural income for the family, Arfenia would like to enlarge her farm. She asks this loan of USD 3,000, which would enable her to purchase two cows, two calves, and forage for feeding the livestock. As this is the first loan for Arfenia, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. The loan will be a great support for this hard working-woman and her family.

loans.use: to purchase two cows, two calves, and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Banguka Group

texts.fr:
Anastasie fait partie du groupe  Banguka et habite à Gitega. Elle a 39 ans et est mariée à Dismas, un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants âgés de 9 à 23 ans, dont  6 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de bananes depuis  20 ans.

Elle est à son dixième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’elle obtient, elle va augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de bananes  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Anastasie is a member of the Banguka group and lives in Gitega. She is 39 years old and married to Dismas, a farmer. Together they have 7 children between the ages of 9 and 23, 6 of whom are in school. 

She has been selling bananas for 20 years. This is her tenth loan through Turame. With the Kiva loan she receives, she will increase her capital and buy lots of bananas which she will resell to earn more money.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy lots of bananas that she will resell to earn more money.

loans.name: Izigire Group

texts.fr:
Dismas  fait partie du groupe  Izigire et habite à Gitega. Il a 42 ans et est marié à Radegonde, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants  dont  4 étudient.

Il fait le commerce de boutique(riz, hricot, sel,...) depuis  8 ans.

Il  est à son treizième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’il obtient, il va augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’articles  de sa boutique (riz, haricot, sel, ...) à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en: Dismas is a member of the Izigire group and lives in Gitega. He is 42 years old and married to Radegonde, a farmer. Together they have 6 children, 4 of whom are in school. He has sold items from his store (rice, beans, salt, etc.) for 8 years. This is his 13th loan through Turame. With the Kiva loan he receives, he will increase his capital and buy several items for his store (rice, beans, salt, etc.) that he will resell in order to earn more.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy various items (rice, beans, salt, etc.) to resell in order to earn more money.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
Khursheed is a 45-year-old married woman, and has been doing business selling milk for many years. She has one milking buffalo and one milking cow. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. She has become famous for providing good quality milk in her community. 

Khursheed has five children, all of whom go to school. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life, good education, food and clothing.  

She has improved her business to meet day to day expenses of life. It is her sixth year with Kashf Foundation, and she is happily running her business with the support of the Foundation. Now, she has requested for a loan of Rs 45,000 to purchase one more buffalo. She is hopeful to get increase her income through her larger sales.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana isa 23-year-old married woman; she has been doing business selling milk for many years. She has three buffaloes in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to lead her decent life. She has five children; all are school going. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food, and clothing.  

She has improved her business to meet day to day expenses of life.  It’s her fifth year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through its support. Now she requests a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase one more buffalo. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Maria Eufemia

texts.es:
La señora María se dedica al comercio su fuente principal de ingreso proviene de su negocio, tiene una cafetería escolar en su comunidad  y la atiende hace 1 año.
Doña María alquila esta caseta durante el periodo de clases y sus principales clientes son alumnos y maestros, también se dedica a la venta de nacatamales y tamalitos de elote de manera ambulante.
Doña María cuenta con el apoyo de su hija para la preparación de su producto, solicita el apoyo del préstamo para la compra de producto como plátanos, yuca, repollo, salsas, pollo, maíz, etc. para elaborar golosinas y para la elaboración de nacatamales para esta época navideña que se vende bastante este producto. 
Doña María sueña con poder comprar una estufa eléctrica industrial y poder elaborar su platillo típico Tapado de Coco.


Danlí, Honduras – Noviembre 2013
texts.en:
María makes a living as a vendor. Her primary source of income comes from this business. She has a school cafeteria in her community and she has done this work for one year.

María rents this stand during school hours and her main customers are students and teachers. She also sells nacatamales and small sweet corn tamales door to door.

María's daughter helps her prepare her product. She is requesting this loan to buy items such as bananas, yucca, cabbage, sauces, chicken, corn, and more to make snacks and nacatamales for the Christmas season, when she sells a lot of products.

María dreams of being able to buy an industrial electric stove so she can make her traditional dish: Tapado de Coco.

Danlí, Honduras – November 2013

loans.use: to buy bananas, yucca, cabbage, sauces, chicken, corn, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Toch

texts.en: Toch is 40-years-old.  She is married and resides with four children in the Siem Reap Province, Cambodia.  She has been working in construction for more than two years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband is a sculptor who makes an income of $4 each day. Due to the difficulty of her family’s transportation, Toch is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.  This purchase will help her reduce the transportation expenses.  In the future, she would like to raise pigs and help her children earn a higher education.  Moreover, she wants to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado y desea continuar participando en este proyecto porque le ayudo a incrementar el capital del negocio, ella continua con la venta de frutas como por ejemplo piña. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Chacoq” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más piñas.  

(La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Ruth is grateful to Kiva lenders for the loan and she is happy to receive their support. She wants to keep participating in this project because it helped her increase her working capital. She continues to sell fruits, including pineapple. For several years, she has belonged to the Chacoq communal bank. Currently, she is requesting a loan to buy more pineapples.

The city of Pilcopata is the capital of the Kosñipata district, within the Pautambo province, Cusco department, Peru.

loans.use: to buy pineapples.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en: Felomina is 49-years-old, who lives in Cortes, Bohol with her family.  She is married and has seven children.  Her husband works as a farmer in Manga, and Felomina has a barn where she raises hogs for an income. She is asking for a loan to buy feed, another piglet to raise and supplements to keep her pigs healthy. Felomina hopes that someday she will have a sow that will produce more pigs and make a bigger piggery to earn better for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, a piglet and supplements to keep her pigs healthy

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: Luzminda sells fish in their village while her husband does the fishing. She has experienced ups and downs with their business and it is still going for the family. She has successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC that she used to repair their boat.  Recently, she borrowed a new loan to buy fishing nets as she has used the current fishing nets for more than six years now.  In the future, Luzminda wants to build a house and to provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Sokha is 32-years-old.  She is married and resides with three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia.  She has been selling groceries for more than three years, earning approximately $10 per day. Her husband is a driver who earns an income of $7 daily. Due to the lack of funds, Sokha is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase timber to build a new house.  This money will help her provide better living conditions for the family.  In the future, she would like to expand her store and help her children earn a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase timber to build a new house

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es:
Edelmira tiene 45 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Morropon, que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella tiene un negocio donde ofrece venta de cerveza, gaseosas y piqueos que se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, es una mujer emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería adicional para su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Edelmira is 45 years old and lives in the Buenos Aires district, a community that's devoted to agriculture, commerce, and livestock. It's located in the Morropon province in the Piura region of Peru's northern coast. She has a business, located behind her residence, that sells beer, soft drinks, and snacks. She's an enterprising woman who is requesting a loan of 2,500 nuevos soles to purchase additional merchandise for her business, which would create more income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase groceries to stock her store

loans.name: Federico

texts.en:
This is Federico, 59, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Zenaida, an employee, and they have children. He, together with his wife, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Federico operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 350 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand their product inventory.

Federico hopes to expand his business and dreams that his family will always be in good health. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José Antonio, tiene 22 años de edad, el vive en la cálida ciudad de ICA, junto a sus padres hace muchos años, José Antonio es una persona muy responsable y alegre.
El actualmente trabaja en un gimnasio como personal de limpieza y vigilante en el turno de la noche, trabajo el cual lo realiza con mucha responsabilidad y entusiasmo lo cual logra el reconocimiento y confianza de sus jefes.
José Antonio está muy agradecido con los prestatarios de KIVA, ya que el dinero lo invertirá en comprar una cama y artículos para arreglar su cuarto y de esta manera tener un mejor lugar donde vivir.
El sueño de José Antonio es ser un profesional y tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Jose Antonio, 22, has lived in the warm city of Ica with his parents for many years.  Jose Antonio is a very responsible and cheerful person.

He is currently working in a gym as a janitor and night security guard.  He does this work with a lot of responsibility and enthusiasm, and he has gotten the recognition and confidence of his bosses.

Jose Antonio is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because he will invest this loan in the purchase of a bed and some other items to furnish his room.  This way, he can have a better place to live.

Jose Antonio's dream is to become a professional and have his own house.

loans.use: to buy a bed for his room

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her capital and buy various items for her store (beans, rice, cassava flour, etc.) that she will resell to earn more money.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 41 years old and she lives with her family in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. Rita has two daughters and a son. Her husband works at the Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute as a lecturer of History. Rita also has a pedagogical education and now she works at the school as a teacher of Armenian Language and Literature. 

As she says, she loves her work very much and she tries to make her lessons interesting and attractive for pupils. She says that the strategy of her teaching is biased on the aim to make pupils to read books and read a lot of useful literature, and she specially emphasizes the importance of reading the works of  famous Armenian writers. She also has pupils to whom she gives private courses and prepares for the entrance examinations.

Rita asks a loan of 700.000 Armenian drams in order to buy a computer and printer in order to have interesting materials for her lessons.

loans.use: to buy a computer and printer in order to have interesting materials for her lessons

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a second time borrower, and is now applying for a loan of UGX 3,000,000.

He is a single man, and works for UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd as a cleaner. It is through his work that he has managed to buy a piece of land where he is putting up rental houses. He started constructing the houses using the first loan that he repaid well. He is applying for this new loan to take the rentals to another level, as shown by their progress in the photo.  

Francis hopes that when the rentals are fully complete he will be able to earn more income from them. He has one major problem in that it floods whenever it rains heavily, but he is hopefull he will work on it given the loan amount applied.

loans.use: to buy cement and shutters.

loans.name: Nazneen

texts.en: Nazneen is 40 years old and a vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of available of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs 50,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors,  along with packs of lace, zippers and buttons. These items will create a means of increasing her revenues, so she may become able to generate a healthier income. She is in her seventh loan cycle and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors,  along with packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 48 years old and comes from Olkalou. She is married to James, who earns some additional income. They have been blessed with four children, aged 22, 18, 15 and 7 years.

Elizabeth is a farmer who grows maize, beans, potatoes and other vegetables. She has been running this business for the past seven years. She has applied for her first loan, in the amount of KES 20,000, from VisionFund Kenya. The loan capital will enable her to buy some farm inputs, like fertilizer and seed for planting.

Her monthly income right now is KES 8,000. Her plan is to use the profits she anticipates from her expanded business, to educate her children and to pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya. She hopes to be a successful farmer, in the future.

loans.use: to buy some farm inputs, like fertilizer and seed for planting.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 32 years old and she lives in Vanadzor in Lori region. She is married and she has a very pretty daughter. 

Mariam graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical University in the faculty of Primary School and Methodology. Now, she works at the school as a teacher of primary classes. Mariam’s husband is also a teacher at the nearby village school, and he teaches geography. Mariam has wanted to become a teacher since during her childhood; she just dreamed of becoming a teacher like her mother, who at this moment is director of the school where she works. This family of pedagogues appreciates education very much and during the years the people who have been their pupils are very thankful and happy that they had such teacher like them.

Now, Mariam asks for a loan of 700,000 Armenian drams, as she wants to buy a computer which they greatly need during their work and she also wants to buy some literature of methodology.

loans.use: to buy a computer which they greatly need during their work and she also wants to buy some literature of methodology.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. Ten years ago, she began stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. 

She has attained a good number of customers, but, due to a lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. So she applied a loan of Rs. 40,000 to buy more spools of threads, along with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons. It will allow her to stitch up more dresses without delay. She is currently in her third loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads, along with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana, aged 35, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a general store for one year. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. 

In order to avoid shortages, Farzana needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. Farzana has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar and juices. In this way, she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings. She is in her sixth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar and juices.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is 31-year-old married woman, and the mother of two children. She has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has one buffalo, which she uses for milk, selling to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit.  

Rehana has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently, she is in her third loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase one more buffalo. Rehana is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Haliman

texts.en:
Haliman is a 33-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of buying and selling animals for many years. She buys animals such as calves and heifers at low prices and then works hard to raise these animals for one to two years. Then she sells them in her community and earns a reasonable amount of profit. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

Haliman has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Now, she has requested a loan of Rs. 45,000 to purchase two more calves. She is in her sixth loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Asima

texts.en:
Asima is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a business manufacturing flowers for the past three years. She offers various colorful flowers for decorating homes and events like birthdays, parties, etc. She sells them to the people of her community and also supplies the local market. She also arranges handmade wedding garlands for brides and grooms and flowers out of every material she finds suitable.  She has good communication skills and has a good client list. She is motivated to provide for her family. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy raw material such as glace paper, floral tape, and green tape, along with packs of paints in various colors. In this way she would be able to meet with the increasing demands of her customers consistently. She wishes to spend part of the revenue to deal with the expenses of her family and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as glace paper, floral tape, and green tape, along with packs of paints in various colors.

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Farah is a 31-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has four years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts in years. 

She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand in her store. It’s her third year with Kashf Foundation and she has shown good repayment behavior. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Rukkia

texts.en:
Rukkia is 44 years old, married, and the mother of four children. 

The man shown in the photo is Rukkia’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Rukkia has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Rukkia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Gelasia

texts.en:
Gelasia is a 62-year-old married woman with 12 children, who are mostly adults. She is from Panglao, Bohol in the Philippines. 

Gelasia has been engaged in a sari-sari (local convenience store) and a habal-habal (motorcycle) transport business for quite some time now, as well as in farming corn. She helps manage the businesses with her son, focusing on the habal-habal business. Her husband's focus is more on farming.

She is asking for a loan to buy tires and gasoline, necessary for the daily operation of her habal-habal. She hopes to save for the future and also to continue expanding her business to support her household needs.

loans.use: to buy tires and gasoline

loans.name: Akbika

texts.ru: Акбика сельская трудолюбивая женщина, ей 60 лет. Она большую часть своей жизни занималась растениеводством и животноводством. В этом году уже 42 года как она занимается этими деятельностьями. Акбика живет и трудится в районе Джиликуль. Она жена, мать и бабушка. Акбика выращивает на орошаемом земельном участке сельскохозяйственную культуру и сейчас всецело поглощена посевом пшеницы. Она просит кредит, чтобы приобрести семена пшеницы и минеральных удобрений. Она очень нуждается в этом кредите. Акбика за счет прибыли с продажи урожая пшеницы хочет провести торжество по случаю обрезания внука.
texts.en: Akbika is a hard-working woman living in a rural area. She is 60 years old. For much of her life, she has been growing crops and raising livestock. She has been doing it for 42 years already. Akbika lives and works in the Jilikul Region. She is a wife, mother and grandmother. Akbika grows crops on her irrigated land plot. At present, she is fully focused on planting wheat. She is requesting a loan in order to buy wheat seeds and mineral fertilizers. She really needs this loan. Akbika plans to use her revenue from selling her wheat harvest to pay for the party to celebrate her grandson's circumcision.

loans.use: to buy wheat seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Herycristy

texts.en:
Herycristy is married with three children. She is 36 years old and lives in Maikay, Tudela, Philippines.

Herycristy sells assorted goods to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 30,000 PHP to restock her store with basic commodities.

Herycristy has been a member of PMPC for a month.  In the future, Herycristy hope to save for some emergencies.

loans.use: to buy more basic commodities to sell in her store

loans.name: Gresfel

texts.en:
Gresfel is married with three children. He is 39 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Gresfel is a farmer and grows a coconut crop to earn a living. He has been doing this for 10 years. He has requested a loan to purchase sacks of fertilizers.

Gresfel has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Gresfel hopes to save for his family's consumption.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Polleritas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “POLLERITAS”  iniciará el vigésimo y quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Hortencia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chalecos, venta de abarrotes, venta de chalinas, venta de comida, venta de masitas, tienda de barrio, taller de costura y chicharronería (comida tradicional de Bolivia).

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Hortencia es integrante, ella indica que hace veinte y cuatro ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de prendas de vestir; cuenta que este negocio lo implementaron por iniciativa propia al separarse de su esposo, ya que necesitaba una fuente de ingresos económicos y al saber la técnica de costura decide implementar un taller de costura.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de telas) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues es divorciada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Polleritas" communal bank will begin its 25th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Collpani group. It is made up of 9 members and is led by a board of directors, of which Hortencia is president. The members of this communal bank run a variety of different businesses, among which are: grocery stores and neighborhood markets, seamstresses, and businesses selling jackets, scarves, cakes, and chicharrones (a traditional Bolivian food).

This new loan will benefit micro-entrepreneurs like Hortencia. She says that 24 loan cycles ago, she entered the communal bank with Pro Mujer after receiving an invitation from a loan officer who visited her home. Hortencia currently makes a living sewing garments. She began this business on her own when she separated from her husband, because she needed a way to earn money and she knew how to sew so she opened a seamstress shop.

The loan she is taking out now will be used to increase her capital by purchasing fabrics, which she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz. She will then sell the fabrics from her shop. Now that she is divorced, this work permits Hortencia to generate sufficient income to maintain her home and support her son on her own. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase fabric.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina helps her husband manage their farm to make a living. She has been selling vegetables in their village and she earns well for the family. She has successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC, which she used for farm inputs. Currently, she took a new loan to buy organic fertilizer and pesticides in order to boost her farm. She is hoping to expand her vegetable garden to have a better source of income for the family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras 2014 Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS 2014”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Quillabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de la Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mirian ella es soltera y tiene 26 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de verduras y frutas, la socia vende manzanas,naranjas,uvas,platanos y mandarinas, la socia también vende zanahorias, tomates y pepinos, la socia tiene un puesto de mercado donde vende las frutas y verduras, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las frutas y verduras. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar naranjas, plátanos, uvas, cebollas, zanahorias y pepinos.
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de agricultura.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS 2014” communal bank, located in the Quillabamba district, within the Convencion province and Cusco department.

Mirian is 26 years old and has two children.  She has a business where she sells fruits and vegetables, such as apples, oranges, grapes, bananas, and mandarin oranges.  She also sells carrots, tomatoes, and cucumbers from a stall in the market, works from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm, and has been doing so for seven years.  Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell fruits and vegetables.  She is asking for a loan to buy oranges, bananas, grapes, onions, carrots, and cucumbers.

The other members sell animals, vegetables, have grocery stores, and farm.

She is grateful to those who form part of this dream and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Andrés se siente contento por el anterior préstamo porque le ayudo a comprar animales menores entonces incremento el capital del negocio y le fue muy bien por lo tanto él continua dedicándose a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, patos y gallinas. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Chacoq” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más cuyes y patos. (La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en: Andrés is happy with the previous loan because it helped him buy small animals and he was able to increase his working capital.  Things went well and he continues to raise small animals such as Guinea pigs, ducks, and chickens.  He has been with the “Chacoq” communal bank for several years and needs a loan to Guinea pigs and ducks.  (Pilcopata is the capital of the Kosñipata district, within the Paucartambo province of the Cusco department of Peru).

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and ducks.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar Augusto tiene 28 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad donde se puede encontrar grandes depósitos de piedra y ripio que la población utiliza para la construcción de sus viviendas, la mayoría de la población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado a una hora con veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedican a vender verduras cebolla, tomate, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra es su mismo domicilio, son una familia unida que se esfuerza en la labor que realizan, Cesar ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de verduras para ofrecer a sus clientes, generándole ingresos mayores para su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar Augusto is 28 years old, and he lives with his wife and children in the district of Cayaltí, a community where one can find great deposits of rock and gravel, which the people use to build their homes. 

Most of the people there work in agriculture, trade, and cattle raising. It is located about an hour and twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo, which lies within the Cajamarca Region on Peru’s northern coast.

Together with his wife, he sells vegetables such as onions and tomatoes, running his business from his own home.  They are a united family who put a lot of effort into their work. 

Cesar has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase a variety of vegetables that he can offer to his customers, generating more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of vegetables to offer to his customers.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
María Teresa tiene 40 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, es una comunidad tranquila, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de animales patos, gallinas y cuyes, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su propio domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 500 nuevo soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María Teresa is forty years old.  She lives together with her family in the district of Cayaltí.  The people here make a living in agriculture, trade, and livestock.  This simple and calm community is located in the Chiclayo province, with is in the greater Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

She makes a living selling animals like ducks, chickens, and guinea pigs.  Her business is located in her own home.  She has requested a loan of 3.500 soles in order to purchase feed to fatten her animals.  In this way, she will be able to generate a higher income for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed to fatten her animals.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is married and has two school going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a fish selling business for the last four years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil and firewood for her business. She decided to join Yehu to acquire financial services for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a single woman, with one child who is still underage. She lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water.

Fatuma has operated a fruit-selling business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbours and passerby. She sells fruits such as oranges, coconuts and mangoes, and she cites seasonality as her major challenge. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase two sacks of coconuts, mangoes and oranges, for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of coconuts, mangoes and oranges, for resale

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is 56 years old and lives in Vanadzor in Lori region. Hasmik is married and she has two sons; her elder son is married and lives with his family. 

Hasmik has a higher education, and she simultaneously works in two places as an accountant. She is doing her best to help her sons financially. Her sons are employed; the elder one is a lecturer at Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute and her second son works as a radio operator. 

Hasmik has requested a loan of 450,000 Armenian drams in order to pay for her second son’s wedding party, who is going to get married.

loans.use: to pay for her second son’s wedding party, who is going to get married.

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika is a widowed woman with eight children, two of whom attend school, and six are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over two years, she has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the loan of KES 50,000, she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruit, tomatoes, potatoes and onions to re-sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruit, tomatoes, potatoes and onions to re-sell.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen has successfully built her business recycling plastic scrap with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. Parveen sells plastic items that she finds in scraps to the nearby markets and people living around her house, and makes a sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family's income.  

She has previously taken a loan to purchase a molding machine; now, she has requested a loan of Rs. 60,000 to purchase another molding machine. It will help her to consistently meet the increasing demands of her customers on time. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend the part of her income on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase another molding machine for her plastic recycling business.

loans.name: Al-Khaeir Group

texts.en:
Al-Khaeir is a group consisting of three ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 240,000 YER from AMB. 

Bushra is a 37-year-old married woman who has four children. She works hard and does her best to provide her family with food and clothing. She is a housewife and dreams of raising her children well. She lives with her family in bad conditions, and she would like to complete her building, but she suffers from a lack of money. So, she applied for a loan of 100,000 YER to buy construction supplies to use for building her house. In the future, she hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use for building her house.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 54-year-old, married woman. She has been running a small general store in her community, successfully. She has two years of experience in this field. Her husband assists her, by purchasing goods from the market for her to stock. He has maintained many contacts at the market, for years.

Salma is motivated to provide her family with good-quality food, clothing and health care. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000. She will use the capital to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages, to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings, and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 41-year-old married woman, and has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan for Rs 50,000, which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Aasia

texts.en:
Aasia is 41 years old and is married. She is the mother of seven children, and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, health and education.

Aasia is involved in a business selling dates; she has been doing it for many years with the support of her husband. She earns a good amount of income to contribute to her family income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently, she is in her sixth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will help her to purchase good quality dates in large quantities to meet the increasing demands of her customers. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase good quality dates in large quantities.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
