Irshad is a 45-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her son at the corner of her house. She has two years of experience in this field. Her son also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts in years. 

She is the mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her sixth loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Hameeda

texts.en:
Hameeda has successfully built her business selling recycled goods. She purchases various goods of plastic and iron, and after crushing and pressing them, she sells them in her locality. Her husband also assists her in running this business successfully. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation and Kiva. She has applied for a loan of Rs. 60,000. This will help her to purchase more iron items along with the necessary cutters and tools. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more iron items along with the necessary cutters and tools.

loans.name: Saro

texts.en: Saro is 20 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. To make a living, her husband is working as a construction worker. He makes an income of $5 per day. Due to her family’s transportation difficulties, Saro is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to raise pigs and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchae a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina se dedica a la cria de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche la cual vende a una de las Plantas Industrializadoras de Leche del departamento de La Paz.
Ella vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en la comunidad de Pallina Chico, del Sector Viacha de La provincia Ingavi del Departamento de La Paz a una hora de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar forraje para  la alimentacion del ganado, por lo tanto mejorar su producción, conservando la buena salud de sus vacas.

El sueño de Carolina es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, precautelando la buena salud de ellos.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera  vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Carolina raises dairy cows and sells the milk to milk processing plants in the La Paz department.

She lives with her parents, in the Pallina Chico community, within the Viacha sector, within the Ingavi department of La Paz, one hour from the city of La Paz.

She needs this loan to buy feed for the animals to increase her production and keep the cows healthy.

Carolina’s dream is to increase the number of heads of cattle she has, while keeping them healthy.  This will be her first loan with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Bat

texts.en: Mrs. Bat, 56 years old, lives with her husband and granddaughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband transports passengers between Ulaanbaatar and Ulan-Ude, the capital of Buryatia, Russia, for a living. She has retired from work and gets a state pension. Before retirement, she used to work in a boot factory. Using her previous loan, she completed a house extension, thus living comfortably and warmly in 2013. Recently, her  house roof deteriorated due to the intense bombardment of snow and rain. So she is requesting a loan of 4,000.000 MNT to buy building and insulation material such as shingles, fiberglass, foam and bricks to repair the roof. As a result, her family will continue to live in a comfortable and warm place. Living in a warm house greatly reduces the consumption of coal, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to repair and insulate her roof

loans.name: William Patricio

texts.es:
William tiene 22 años de edad es soltero tiene un hijo que no vive con el, el vive solo en el Canton Ventanas Provincia de Los Rios. 

La ventanilla se llama SAN PEDRO esta venilla se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia Guare, perteneciente al Canton BABA, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agropecuarias (siembra de maiz y arroz). 

William se dedica a la siembra de maiz y arroz en pocas cantidades. 

El dinero lo solicita para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes para el suelo. Con el credito ha podido lograr pagar los gastos de la produccion como el transporte y la alimentacion. 

Sus compras las realiza en Ventanas en Comercial Lopez. 

Su metas es tener mas ingresos para poder comprar terrenos para seguir sembrando.

Los desafios que enfrenta son las enfermedades como cogollera que daña los cultivos. En los tiempos libres me gusta ver television especialmente peliculas de terror.
texts.en:
William, 22, is single and has one son who doesn't live with him. He lives alone in the Ventanas canton, Los Rios district. William makes a living planting corn and sugar in small quantities.

The San Pedro communal bank is in the Guare parish, Baba canton. The members of this bank work in agriculture by planting corn and rice.

He is requesting this loan to buy seeds, manure, and fertilizer for the land. With this loan, he will be able to pay for his production expenses such as transportation and food.

He makes his purchases in Ventanas at the Lopez store.

His goal is to have more income to buy land and keep planting. He faces challenges such as illnesses like cholera, which damage his crops. In his free time, he likes to watch TV—especially scary movies.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jeny Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Jeny es una persona muy honesta y responsable, vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposo y su hijo. Su negocio es una pulpería desde hace 8 años.
Doña Jeny tiene su pulpería ubicada a las orillas de la calle principal de su comunidad. Está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de más productos como ser: maíz, manteca, huevos, queso, refrescos, churros, arroz, frijoles, pan, café, mantequilla, carne, jugos, etc. producto que necesita para surtir su negocio.
Doña Jeny espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucha ayuda ya que gracias a el contara con los insumos necesarios para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y así mismo satisfacer las necesidades de estos, de igual manera que sus ventas tengan un aumento y gracias a este ganar más ingresos que beneficien el estilo de vida y el de su familia en el hogar.
Doña Jeny espera aumentar su negocio y seguir apoyando a su familia y que su hijo cumpla sus metas y sueños así como el de que terminen los estudios y se conviertan en una persona de bien.


Choluteca, Honduras – Noviembre 2013
texts.en:
Jeny is a very responsible and honest person. She lives with her husband and son in the southern part of Honduras. She has owned her business, a small store, for 8 years now. Her store is located right on the main street of her community. She is requesting the loan to purchase more products for her business such as: corn, butter, eggs, cheese, sodas, churros, rice, beans, bread, coffee, margarine, meat and juices. These are all times she needs to stock her business.

Jeny hopes that the loan is useful and helpful and that thanks to the loan she will have the necessary supplies to cover the demand and satisfy the needs of her clients. She also hopes that her sales will increase and that thanks to this she will earn more money which will benefit her lifestyle and her family's home life. Jeny hopes to grow her business and to continue supporting her family. She also hopes that her son will fulfill his goals and dreams of finishing school and that he becomes a good person. 

Choluteca, Honduras – November 2013

loans.use: to purchase corn, butter, eggs, cheese, sodas, churros, rice, beans, bread, coffee, margarine, meat, and juice for her business.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. 

She is requesting a new loan of KES 20,000 to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Mariana Esther

texts.es:
Mariana tiene 27 años de edad vive en Union Libre tiene tres hijos vive con su familia en casa de sus padres en el Canton Ventanas Provincia de Los Rios.

La ventanilla se llama SAN PEDRO  esta venilla se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia Guare, perteneciente al Canton BABA, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agropecuarias (siembra de maiz y arroz).

Mariana se dedica a la siembra de maiz y arroz en pocas cantidades. El dinero lo solicita para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes para el suelo. Con el credito ha podido lograr pagar los gastos de la produccion como el transporte y la alimentacion.

Sus compras las realiza en Ventanas en Coercial Lopez.

Su metas es tener mas ingresos para poder comprar una finca para seguir sembrando.Los desafios que enfrenta son las enfermedades como cogollera que daña los cultivos.

En los tiempos libres me gusta pasear con la familia.
texts.en:
Mariana is 27 years old. She is in a common law marriage and has three children.  She lives with her parents in the Ventanas settlement located in the Los Rios province.

The area is called SAN PEDRO and is located in the Guare parish, part of the BABA settlement. This area is a farming area (corn and rice).

Madiana raises corn and rice in small quantities. The money she is requesting is for purchasing seeds, compost, and fertilizers for the soil. With the loan, she could pay the production expenses like transportation and feeding the soil.

She makes her purchases in Ventanas at the Lopez commercial area.

Her goals are to have a greater income and be able to buy a farm on which to keep planting.  Her challenges include freezes which damage the crops.

She likes to spend time with her family in her free time.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 63 años de edad vive en Union Libre tiene cinco hijos vive con su familia vive en el Canton Ventanas Provincia de Los Rios.

La ventanilla se llama SAN PEDRO  esta venilla se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia Guare, perteneciente al Canton BABA, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agropecuarias (siembra de maiz y arroz).

Pedro se dedica a la siembra de maiz y arroz en pocas cantidades. El dinero lo solicita para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes para el suelo. Con el credito ha podido lograr pagar los gastos de la produccion como el transporte y la alimentacion.

Sus compras las realiza en Ventanas en Comercial Lopez.

Su metas es tener mas ingresos para poder comprar terrenos para dejar a los hijos que sigan trabajando. Los desafios que enfrenta son las enfermedades como cogollera que daña los cultivos.

En los tiempos libres me gusta descansar.
texts.en:
Pedro is 63 years old.  He is in a common law marriage and has five children.  He lives with his parents in the Ventanas settlement located in the Los Rios province.

The area is called SAN PEDRO and is located in the Guare parish, part of the BABA settlement. This area is a farming area (corn and rice).
 
Pedro raises corn and rice in small quantities. The money he is requesting is for purchasing seeds, compost, and fertilizers for the soil. With the loan, he could pay the production expenses like transportation and feeding the soil.

He makes his purchases in Ventanas at the Lopez commercial area.

His goals are to have a greater income and be able to buy land to leave to his children so that they can keep working.  His challenges include freezes which damage the crops.

He likes to relax in his free time.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is 54 years old and a married woman. She has been running a business, buying and selling animals, for many years. She buys animals (such as calves and heifers) at low prices, and then works hard to raise these animals for one to two years. She then sells them in her community, earning a reasonable amount of profit. She also sells milk, to generate an extra amount of income.

She has gradually improved her business, with the support of Kashf Foundation. Most recently, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000, which she would use to purchase two more calves. She is in her third loan cycle, and she has a good repayment history. She is very experienced in her business and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Zaitoon

texts.en:
Zaitoon is a 42-year-old, married woman, and the mother of eight children. With her husband, she has been running a business selling milk, for the past five years. She has two cows, which she uses for milk to sell to the people of her locality. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis, to generate an extra amount of profit. Zaitoon has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income.

She has gradually improved her business, with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her fourth loan cycle, and she has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will enable her to purchase one more cow. It will help her to grow her sales, which ultimately will generate more profit for her.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 42 years old, married, and the mother of six children. 

She has had a business doing hand-embroidery for the past nine years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed as a salesperson in a grocery store and does not earn enough to support his family well. 

Shamim’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. To cope with the increasing demands of her customers, she applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 through Kashf foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities. She shared her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Ligia

texts.en:
Ligia and Leonardo, natives of Nicaragua, are the owners of “Chicos Little Explorer, LLC”, a daycare center located in their home in Woodbridge, VA. The couple not only shares the property of the business, but they also work together in the childcare center. After having an accident at work and losing partial vision, Leonardo started to work full-time in the care center helping his wife. Ligia obtained her preschool teacher credentials in Spanish and English while attending Northern Virginia Community College, allowing her to provide a service with an emphasis on bilingual care and teaching. 

Ligia and Leonardo are asking for a $10,000 loan to build an outdoor playground park with games and other activities, as well as to buy tables, chairs, mats, and other elements necessary to continue offering quality service and receive more children who are on a long waiting list.

Also, the center needs to build a website, which will allow potential clients to find the center, aid in establishing credibility as a business, and facilitate communication with parents. In addition, the center needs to wrap its transportation vehicle with the company logo and phone number.

Ligia and Leonardo have three kids, and the older daughter is in college in Florida. She is the first in the family going to college.

loans.use: to build an outdoor playground park with games and other activities, as well as to buy tables, chairs, mats, and other necessary elements.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is a 50-year-old, married woman. She has been running a business with her husband, selling milk, for many years. She has two cows and one buffalo, which she uses for milk to sell to the people of her locality. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis, to generate an extra amount of profit. Sughran has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough profit to contribute to her family's income.

She has gradually improved her business, with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her sixth loan cycle, and she has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Sughran is hoping that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Mary Julfel

texts.en:
Mary Julfel, 52, is married with four children. She lives in Gumbil, Tudela, in the Philippines.

To earn a living, she has a ready-to-wear business. She has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for five years. 

In the future, Mary Julfel hopes to provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to restock her shop with ready-to-wear items

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is married to a farmer in their village and she helps him work on their farm to make a living. She has been growing and harvesting vegetables for eight years and she earns well for the family. She took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy organic fertilizer and pesticides. She wants to expand their farm to develop a better source of income in the near future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn's husband works on their farm to make a living, while she sells goods in her retail store. She has been doing this work for many years and she earns well for the family.

With her income from the business, she has successfully repaid her previous loan, used for the business. Currently, she has taken a new loan from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. 

She plans to use the additional revenue she generates to improve and expand her business, thus ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma has a small store at home selling groceries in their village to make a living. She has been doing this for many years, earning well for the family and she had successfully repaid her previous loans from GDMPC. She used her loan to buy additional stocks for the store. Recently she took a new loan to purchase more grocery items to sell. She always finds ways to augment their living. She plans to expand her business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Futuro De Vida  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Futuro de Vida, está conformado por 5 socias y 1 socio quienes laboran a diario en diferentes actividades económicas, las que les permiten aportar a la economía de sus hogares y salir adelante con sus familias, son personas amables y gentiles que mantienen su cultura y tradiciones. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca que es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de quienes la visitan.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora María, es socia del banco comunal Futuro de Vida desde hace 5 años, tiempo en el que ha establecido una muy buena amistad con todos los miembros del grupo. 
La Señora María tiene 31 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de 3 años de edad, su esposo labora en un taller de latonería (arreglo de latas vehículos), no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 
Doña María se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y a la venta de una gran variedad de cosméticos, tiene este negocio desde hace dos años y labora de domingo a domingo. También desde hace dos años se dedica a elaborar  guaipe. 
Su crédito lo va a invertir comprando cosméticos para aumentar su mercadería, al igual que tela para el guaipe. Su meta es dedicarse a la venta de comida rápida y tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The “Futuro de Vida” lending group is made up of five ladies and one gentleman who work daily in their different activities that allow them to sustain their households and come out ahead with their families.  They are friendly and gentle people who keep their cultures and traditions.  

They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca which has been a World Heritage Site since December, 1999.  Its food captures the pallet of those who visit.

Maria has been one of the members of the “Futuro de Vida” comunal bank for five years and has established a good friendship with all the group’s members.  Maria is 31 years old, married, and has three children.  Her husband works in a copperware shop.  The rent their home.

Maria does the housework and sells cosmetics.  She has had this business for two years and works seven days a week.  The has also been making guaipes for two years.

She will use the money from this loan to buy cosmetics to increase her inventory.  She will also buy fabric to make guaipes.  Her goal is to begin selling fast food and have a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and fabric.

loans.name: Savoert's Group

texts.en: Savoert is 30 years old, and married with two children. She and her husband live in a village of the Sangke district of Battambang province. To make a living, she and her husband have been working as house painters for 11 years, earning about 40,000 KHR per day to meet the family needs.  Savoert is a third cycle client. She has successfully used the past loans to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy painting materials for supporting her business. She hopes to earn more income from her current business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy painting materials for supporting her business.

loans.name: Katherine Del Rocio

texts.es:
Katherine del Rocío tiene 22 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad urbana de Cayaltí, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Katherine del Rocío is twenty-two years old.  She lives with her parents in Cayaltí, an urban community whose residents work in agriculture, trade, and raising livestock.  Cayaltí is located about two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.

She makes a living selling beauty products.  Her business is located in her home.  She has requested a loan of 1,000 soles in order to purchase merchandise to stock her business.  In this way, she will be able to generate a higher income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of cosmetics to offer her customers.

loans.name: Aun

texts.en: Aun is 43 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband sells wax. He makes an income of $8 daily. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $10 each day. To improve her family’s finance, Aun is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase wax and cattle to resell. By doing so, she will be able to generate more profit.  In the future, she would like to expand the business, and help her children earn higher education.

loans.use: to purchase wax and cattle to resell.

loans.name: Albina

texts.en: Albina is a married woman from Cortes, Bohol. She is 42-years-old with four children, ages 11-20.  Albina owns a sari-sari store where she sells canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, coffee, sugar and cooking oil. She requested a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy additional merchandise like noodles, bath soap, shampoo, candies, cooking oil and chips. Her business provides food for her family and helps to pay for her children's education.  In the future, she hopes to be more successful in her business and continue to expand to uplift her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy noodles, bath soap, shampoo, candies, cooking oil and chips

loans.name: Edicta Adelina

texts.es:
Edicta tiene 25 años de edad es soltera tiene dos hijos vive con su familia en casa de sus padres en el Canton Ventanas Provincia de Los Rios.

La ventanilla se llama SAN PEDRO  esta venilla se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia Guare, perteneciente al Canton BABA, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agropecuarias (siembra de maiz y arroz).

Edicta se dedica a la siembra de maiz y arroz en pocas cantidades. El dinero lo solicita para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes para el suelo. Con el credito ha podido lograr pagar los gastos de la produccion como el transporte y la alimentacion.

Sus compras las realiza en Ventanas en Comercial Lopez.

Su metas es tener mas ingresos para poder comprar terrenos para seguir sembrando.Los desafios que enfrenta son las enfermedades como cogollera que daña los cultivos.

En los tiempos libres me gusta ver television.
texts.en:
Edicta is 25 years old. She is single and has two children.  She lives with her parents in the Ventanas settlement located in the Los Rios province.

The area is called SAN PEDRO and is located in the Guare parish, part of the BABA settlement. This area is a farming area (corn and rice).

Edicta raises corn and rice in small quantities. The money she is requesting is for purchasing seeds, compost, and fertilizers for the soil. With the loan, she could pay the production expenses like transportation and feeding the soil.

She makes her purchases in Ventanas at the Lopez commercial area.

Her goals are to have a greater income and be able to buy land on which to keep planting.  Her challenges include freezes which damage the crops.

She likes to watch television in her free time.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Brenda Suyapa

texts.es:
La señora Brenda es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora vive en  una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva desde hace 10 años, los cuales vende en su comunidad a diario y en los distintos caseríos cercanos a la misma. 
Doña Brenda necesita el préstamo para la compra de más producto como ser: pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos, shorts, blusas, camisetas, etc. para cubrir la demanda que tiene su producto. 
Doña Brenda espera con  el préstamo poder contar con el producto necesario para cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes ya que este momento no cuenta con este, además un aumento en sus ventas y gracias a este poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Doña Brenda espera hacer crecer su negocio en unos años y de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia y  que sus hijos continúen con los estudios.



Choluteca, Honduras – Noviembre 2013
texts.en:
Brenda is a very responsible and hardworking person who lives in a southern Honduras community with her husband and two children.  She has been selling new clothing in different neighborhoods in her community for ten years.

Brenda needs this loan to buy more merchandise: pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, shorts, blouses, t-shirts, etc. to cover her customer demand.

Brenda expects that this loan will allow her to have the necessary merchandise so she can cover her customer requests, increase her sales, and be able to improve her quality of life.

Brenda hopes to grow her business in a few years and continue to support her family and so that her children will continue their educations.

Choluteca, Honduras – November 2013

loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: Fernando Leonardo

texts.es:
Fernando tiene 23 años de edad vive es soltero no tiene hijos  vive con la mama en casa de ella en el Canton Ventanas Provincia de Los Rios.

La ventanilla se llama SAN PEDRO  esta venilla se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia Guare, perteneciente al Canton BABA, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agropecuarias (siembra de maiz y arroz).

Fernando se dedica a la siembra de maiz y arroz en pocas cantidades. El dinero lo solicita para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes para el suelo. Con el credito ha podido lograr pagar los gastos de la produccion como el transporte y la alimentacion.

Sus compras las realiza en Ventanas en Coercial Lopez.

Su metas es tener mas ingresos para poder comprar terrenos para seguir sembrando.Los desafios que enfrenta son las enfermedades como cogollera que daña los cultivos.

En los tiempos libres me gusta hacer deporte con los amigos.
texts.en:
Fernando is 23 years old. He is single and has no children.  He lives with his mother in the Ventanas settlement located in the Los Rios province.

The area is called SAN PEDRO and is located in the Guare parish, part of the BABA settlement. This area is a farming area (corn and rice).

Fernando raises corn and rice in small quantities. The money he is requesting is for purchasing seeds, compost, and fertilizers for the soil. With the loan, he could pay the production expenses like transportation and feeding the soil.

He makes his purchases in Ventanas at the Lopez commercial area.

His goals are to have a greater income and be able to buy land on which to keep planting.  His challenges include freezes which damage the crops.

He likes to play sports with his friends in his free time.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: Don Guadalupe es originario de la ciudad de Boaco, casado y padre de cuatro hijos. De 38 años de edad. Es de oficio Agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de Maíz y Trigo y tambien a la venta de artículos de plástico y de aluminio. Inicio su negocio hace varios años con la venta de artículos de plástico y de aluminio, poco a poco ha expandido su venta a otros departamentos del país y ha logrado salir adelante. Su meta próxima es terminar el corte de Maíz y trigo que tiene sembrado. Solicita el crédito para comprar artículos tales como: Porras, Panas, Cucharas, Vasos etc., todos de plástico y aluminio. Estima que el crédito le ayudara a incrementar sus ventas y lograr salir adelante. Su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa y poder vivir en un ambiente más cómodo.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a native of the city of Boaco.  He is married and is the father of four children.  He is thirty-eight years old and works in agriculture.  He makes a living growing corn and wheat, but also sells plastic and aluminum goods.  

He began this business selling plastic and aluminum items several years ago.  Little by little, he has expanded his sales to other areas of the country, which has enabled him to get ahead in life.  His next goal is to finish harvesting the corn and wheat that he has already planted.  

He is requesting this loan to buy more plastic and aluminum goods, including pots, containers, spoon, glasses, etc.  He believes that the loan will help him to grow his sales and move himself forward.  His future plan is to improve the infrastructure of his house so that he and his family can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy plastic and aluminum goods like pots, containers, spoons, glasses, etc.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en: Edgar is married and manages his own vulcanizing and repair shop to earn a living. He has been serving their village for many years, providing repairs and vehicle maintenance and he earns well for the family. To improve his services, he took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy motor spare parts and vehicle fuel to be used for repair and maintenance services. In the future, Edgar wants to improve the general living situation of his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and fuel for his repair business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more blouses, slippers, and used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of merchandise and to grow her earnings.

loans.name: Arche

texts.en: Arche is married to a public teacher in their village.  He earns income from his fishing business to augment their living. For three years, Arche has earned a better income fishing, so he has decided to expand his business. Without hesitation, Arche took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy a boat to be used for fishing. He is hopeful to earn more income for a better living for his family in the future.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat.

loans.name: Magaly Salvadora

texts.es: La señora Magaly es madre y es propietaria de una tienda de productos comestibles ubicada en villa lobos 1 zona 12 la tienda que ella administra tiene 12 años de tenerla cuando ella empezó era pequeño el negocio pero con el tiempo creció un poco mas y gracias a al Apoyo de kiva, su negocio ha sido de mucho beneficio para apoyar a su familia con los ingresos del negocio ella lucha diariamente por darle lo mejor a sus hijos esta es la razón por la cual ella solicita su crédito para poder invertir aun mas en su negocio y de esa manera ofrecer un mejor servicio y variedad de productos a sus clientes y la meta y sueños es que el negocio siga creciendo a un mas.ella ya ha trabajado dos creditos anteriores y no a caido en mora es una persona muy responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en: Magaly is a mother and is the owner of a grocery store located in Villa Lobos I, Zone 12. She has had the store that she manages for 12 years. When she started, the business was small but with time it grew a little bigger and thanks to the support of Kiva, her business has been very helpful in supporting her family with its income. She struggles daily to provide the best for her children. This is why she is requesting her loan, so that she may invest even more in her business and in this way offer a better service and variety of products to her customers. Her goal and dream is for the business to continue to grow even more. She has already worked for two previous loans and did not default; she is a very responsible person with her payments.

loans.use: buy products for daily consumption.

loans.name: Stellah

texts.en:
Stellah is a 33-year-old lady from Kakamega County. She is married to Jacob who is also a business man in the same town. They have two children, aged 7 and 10, respectively.

Stellah operates a salon business which she has done for the last three years. She earns an average income of KES 18,000 per month. She is taking her first loan of KES 10,000 with Vision Fund Kenya to buy salon equipment and chemicals. The profits will be used to repay the loan and do some saving. Her dream is to prosper.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment and chemicals.

loans.name: Elizeba

texts.en: Elizeba is a 59-year-old married woman who supports three members of her family. She operates a hotel in Kaptidil centre and is served by Vision Fund Kapsabet office.  She has been in the hotel business for the last thirty years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.  She has borrowed KES 60,000 and plans to use the loan to buy ingredients for food preparation in the hotel (maize, sugar, wheat flour, etc). She will use the profits from the business to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La señora Gladis es una persona muy honesta y responsable, vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Su negocio es una pulpería desde hace 8 años.
Doña Gladis tiene su pulpería en su casa de habitación y es muy visitada y conocida por los vecinos de su comunidad. Está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de más productos como ser: maíz, manteca, huevos, queso, refrescos, churros, arroz, frijoles, pan, café, mantequilla, carne, jugos, etc.
Doña Gladis con este préstamo espera surtir más de producto su negocio y que gracias a este contara con los insumos necesarios para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y así mismo satisfacer las necesidades de estos, de igual manera que sus ventas tengan un aumento y gracias a este ganar más ingresos que beneficien su estilo de vida y el de su familia.
Doña Gladis espera aumentar su negocio y seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que cumplan sus metas y sueños.


Choluteca, Honduras – Noviembre 2013
texts.en:
Gladis is an honest and responsible person who lives in a southern Honduras community with her husband and three children.  She has had a general store for the past eight years.

Gladis has a store in her home and it’s well known and visited by her neighbors in the community.  She is asking for this loan to buy more products such as corn, lard, eggs, cheese, soft drinks, churros, rice, beans, bread, coffee, butter, meat, juices, etc.

Gladis will use this loan to stock her store and be able to have the necessary supplies to cover her customer demand and satisfy their needs.  She will also increase her sales and earn more income that will benefit her family’s lifestyle.

Gladis expects to grow her business and continue supporting her children so that the can achieve their goals and dreams.

Choluteca, Honduras – November 2013

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Bernarda Lila

texts.es: La señora Bernarda, continua con sus planes de vida, ella desea darle a sus hijos las mejores condiciones posibles, su esposo labora para una empresa privada el cual le apoyo con los gastos del hogar, con este credito comprara parte de materiales como Bloques, cemento, Puerta, Zinc ya que construira un cuarto adicional, agradecida con el apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le han brindado
texts.en:
Bernarda continues with her life plan of giving her children the best.  Her husband works at a private business and helps with the home expenses.

With this loan, she will buy construction materials, like blocks, cement, a door, and tin roofing panels.  She will use these items to build and add an additional room to her house.

She is thankful for the support that Kiva and Afodenic have offered her.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a second-time borrower and a client of UGAFODE Microfinance Limited. She is applying for a loan of two million shillings (UGX 2,000,000). She was forced to pay off her previous loan prematurely, so that she could get a bigger loan to buy more stock of items that were being demanded by her customers.

Harriet says the shop is doing well in terms of sales. However, it has been held down by inadequate capital for increasing her stock. But with the loan facility from UGAFODE, her problem will soon be history.

She says she has plans to educate her children, pay off her loan well, and get subsequent loans to make a good credit history. She also wants to buy her own plot and develop it, by putting up a commercial house to avoid paying rent. She is hard-working and honest.

loans.use: to buy items to stock her retail store

loans.name: Aleksandre

texts.en: Aleksandre is a 26-year-old married man from the Gori district. He lives with his wife, an infant son, parents, and grandmother (who is on a pension).  His wife is a sales lady at the local supermarket and Aleksandre and his father work as drivers at a local taxi company. Aleksandre decided to start his own business and requested a loan.  The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $ 3,700 to purchase a secondhand car. After the car is purchased, he will serve local people as a taxi driver and will transport inter-city.  Aleksandre is a highly motivated person who works overtime to generate more income. With increased income he will provide better living conditions to his family.

loans.use: to buy a car to start a taxi business.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
Milagros tiene 32 años de edad, ella vive en la calurosa ciudad de ICA, junto a sus padres. 
Milagros actualmente trabaja como azafata en un restaurante de la misma ciudad, ella es una persona muy carismática y responsable, es por esa razón que en su centro laboral siempre la felicitan por su buen trabajo que realiza día a día.
Milagros está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que el dinero lo invertirá en comprar una cocina para su hogar y de esta manera darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus queridos padres.
El sueño de milagros es tener su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
Milagros is 32 years old and lives with her parents in the warm city of Ica. She currently works as a hostess at a restaurant in the same city. Milagros is a very charismatic and responsible person, which is why she is always happy to do good work at her job day after day.

Milagros is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. The money from the loan will be invested in the purchase of a stove for her home. This will provide a better quality of life for her beloved parents. Milagros says her dream is to have her own restaurant.

loans.use: to buy a stove for her home.

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en:
Bibi is a widowed woman who has been blessed with two children, who are now adults. She lives at her own house that is without electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Bibi has operated a charcoal business, selling from home to her neighbors and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation. She also operates a mobile charging business.

She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase more charcoal and mobile chargers for her business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and mobile chargers for her business

loans.name: Elinita

texts.en: Elinita manages a swine fattening business while her husband fishes to make a living.  She has been doing this for more than three years and she earns well from it so that she was able to repay her previous loan successfully. She used her previous loan to buy feeding supplies. Currently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy feeding supplies and additional piglets.  Improving her business is her desire for she wants to ensure a better living for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies and additional piglets

loans.name: Yaneli

texts.es:
Yaneli es una microempresaria clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:
 
Yaneli tiene 27 años y es madre soltera con 2 hijos. Vive en casa de familiares suyos desde hace 10 años y tiene su negocio de tienda de abarrotes desde hace 6 años.

Su negocio es una tienda de abarrotes que está localizado en un mercado fijo. La gente que va al mercado a surtir sus necesidades aprovecha y compra en la tienda de Yaneli los artículos que necesitan. Este préstamo lo pide para invertirlo en mercancía, surtir bien su negocio, y así tener mayores ventas. 

Gracias al esfuerzo y dedicación que pone en su negocio ha logrado sacar adelante a mis hijos, a pesar de no tener una pareja y no ser apoyada económicamente. Sus retos son seguir esmerándose fuerte al trabajo para darle una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Yaneli is a small entrepreneurial client of Kubo Financiero and this is her story:

Yaneli is 27 years old and the single mother of 2 children.  She has lived with her relatives for ten years and has had a grocery store for six.

Her grocery store is located in a market.  The people who visit the market to meet their needs buy what they need from Yaneli’s store.  She will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise to stock her store well and have better sales.

Thanks to the efforts and dedication that she puts into her business, she has managed to get her children ahead, despite the fact that she doesn’t have a husband nor financial support.  Her challenge is to continue to work hard in her work to have a better life.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Edeline Joy

texts.en: Edeline Joy is studying Bachelor in Elementary Education at Lasalle University in Ozamiz City.  Her determination in pursuing her dreams helped her to compete in school activities.  Her parent's income will not be enough to only focus on her studies for she have four siblings. Her previous loan was used to pay her university fees for the first semester. Currently, she took another loan to pay school tuition fees for the second semester. Edeline Joy is hopeful of finding success in the future and to be able to augment her family's living.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees for the second semester

loans.name: Kamia

texts.en: Kamia is married and helps her husband operate their own farm of rice to make a living.  Doing this for more than seven years, Kamia earns well for the family. She took a new loan from GDMPC micro finance to buy fertilizer for the production of palay. She wants to improve her farm to have a better income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Dúo Bethel Group

texts.es:
Dúo Bethel
Angela  es madre soltera de cinco hijos de (32,28,26,24,20) años de edad, todos  ya han formado su propia familia actualmente vive sola se dedica a su negocio el cual es venta de articulos de consumo diario, ( arroz, frijol, azucar, leche, huevos, etc), inicio su negocio hace 10 años,  solicita un credito para invertir en su negocio ya que se acerca la temporada en la cual se debe invertir mas para asi poder generar mas ganancias, agradece y pide a Dios salud para poder seguir trabajando y asi generar ingresos para sosterse, le gusta mucho su trabajo y ahnela tener un local propio ya que actualmente alquila.
es tu tercer creditos en kiva y no a caido en mora, espera seguir creciendo en su negocio ya que el apoyo de kiva es importante para su negocio.
texts.en:
Dúo Bethel Group

Angela is a single mother of five children (ages 32, 28, 26, 24, and 20). All of them have their own families. Angela currently lives alone and manages a business selling everyday consumer products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, eggs, and other items. She started her business 10 years ago.

Angela is requesting a loan so that she can invest in her business. For the upcoming season, she wants to invest more so that she can generate more income. She is grateful to God and asks that she remain healthy so that she can continue working and generate income to support herself. Angela greatly enjoys her work and hopes to have her own shop since she is currently renting.

She has taken out three Kiva loans and has never fallen behind. Angela hopes to continue growing in her business with the support of Kiva since it is very important to her.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell in her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman. She has five children; three of them attend school and two are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Elizabeth has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable stall operators, in her business.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables, for resale. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Mati

texts.en:
Mati appreciates having been granted her previous loan, which improved her living standard. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

In addition to running her tailoring business, Mati managed to save money and opened a kiosk where she sells food. Now, she would like to apply for a loan of KES 10,000, which she will use to buy more stock, including bananas, sweets, bread, wheat flour, biscuits, rice and sugar. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock for the kiosk, including bananas, bread and rice

loans.name: Dergham

texts.en:
Dergham is from Iraq. He is a youth client of 23 years of age who is single and lives with his parents and four brothers. Dergham, his father, and one of his brothers provide the family living together. He owns a shop where he sells lumber blocks used for building construction. These wooden blocks are used to maintain the balance of a newly constructed building as the cement hardens. Dergham gained his experience by working in a similar shop for several years as an employee. 

In 2010, he established his own business, and now he has four part-time employees hired. He is well-known in his surrounding area with an excellent reputation. Dergham is requesting a youth loan of $1,800 to increase his lumber inventory. He believes that this loan will positively affect the growth of his business and he will easily be able to provide for his family’s needs and provide them with better living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his lumber inventory.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is married with three children; one in school and two adults. They own a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanamisi has operated a clothes selling business for the past five years. She sells in a shop to her town dwellers, passersby, and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional bags of charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr:
Madame Khady s’active dans la vente de petit déjeuner depuis maintenant plus de cinq ans. Elle s’est installée en face du garage des taxi-clando sis dans le marché. Un emplacement qui lui permet cibler toute la clientèle qui fréquente ces parages aussi bien les chauffeurs, que les vendeuses des étalages, mais aussi les clients qui viennent au marché pour faire des courses et ceux qui prennent les taxi. Pour elle donc une grande opportunité d’écouler rapidement les mets qu’elle vend. Elle travaille de 7h 30mn du matin, jusqu’à midi.
Khady est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont l’ainé a 20 ans. Elle participe à la dépense quotidienne et règlent ses  besoins personnels. Grace  aux revenus de son activité, Khady a pu se payer un terrain. Et ses projets dans le futur, serait de construire sa parcelle de terrain, la mettre en location afin de pouvoir en tirer un profit ; acheter un véhicule et en faire aussi une autre source de revenu.
texts.en:
Mrs. Khady has been in the business of selling breakfast for the last five years. She has set her stall across from the independent taxi garage at the market. This location allows her to target all the customers who frequent this area. This includes drivers as well as stall vendors but also customers who come to the market to shop and those who get a taxi. For her it is a great opportunity to quickly sell the meals she makes. She works from 7:30 am to noon.

Khady is married and the mother of five children; the oldest one is 20 years old. She contributes to the daily expenses and provides for her personal needs. Thanks to the income from her business, she has been able to buy land. Her future project would be to build on her piece of land, rent it in order to make a profit,  buy a vehicle and make that another source of revenue.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, oil, onions and various condiments to stock up and prepare the meals she sells.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan de 54 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, ya que en la época de antes solo a la agricultura los inculcaban sus padres.  Juan es casado y ha procreado 5 hijos, de ellos solo cuatro viven con él y de ellos uno estudia y los demás le ayudan a la agricultura. 

Juan se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 14 años de edad, este trabajo se lo enseño el papá ya que desde pequeño les enseño este trabajo, para que en un futuro se pudieran defender este trabajo le queda a una distancia de 15 minutos y él viaja a pie solo a esto se dedica con la ayuda de los hijos que le ayudan, su horario de trabajo es de las 6 de la mañana hasta las doce del mediodía. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para sacar las cosechas del lugar de trabajo, ya que paga la máquina que le desgrane el maíz y también paga carro quien se lo lleve para la casa. Esto mejorara, ya que sacara más luego los granaos del lugar de donde los cultiva y así los tendrá en casa, para sacarlos al mercado más luego y así tener el ingreso y pagar las deudas.
Los sueños que tiene que siempre ha tenido para su vida,  es trabajar y poder sacar todas sus cosechas y comprar una yunta de bueyes para jalar sus cultivos y no tener que pagar y así  ahorrarse es pago y que le quede para el sostén de la familia.
texts.en:
Juan, 54 years old, was not able to attend to school while growing up because at that time parents would only teach their sons about agriculture. Juan is married and has 5 children, 4 of them still living with him, one of those four studies and the rest help Juan with the agriculture. 

Juan has been dedicated to agriculture since he was 14 years old. Since he was young his father taught him the profession so in the future he could earn a living. The land that he works is 15 minutes away from his house. He travels that distance alone and barefoot. He dedicates himself to this activity along with the help of his children. His working schedule goes from 6 am to 12 pm.

The loan he is requesting will help him to get the harvest out of the land that he works. Normally he pays for the corn kernel machine and a carrier to take all the corn back to his house. Covering these expenses will grant him great improvements for he will be able to take the corn out of the fields and into the market in a much faster way, thus getting profits and paying his debts. 

His lifelong dreams consist in working and having successful harvests so he can buy a yoke of oxen. This will save him from the expenses of the carrier and will give him more money to invest in his family.

loans.use: to get the harvest out of the land that he works.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Victor agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contento por el apoyo brindado y desea seguir participando en este proyecto pues le ayudo a incrementar el capital del negocio, él continua con la venta de  frutas como por ejemplo naranjas, mandarinas, piñas y otras cosas más. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Chacoq” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para pagar a los trabajadores que sacaran las frutas de los arboles.
texts.en:
Victor is grateful to the Kiva lenders for his previous loan and is pleased with the support that was given to him. He wants to continue his work with the help of additional business capital. Victor continues to sell fruit such as oranges, tangerines, pineapples, and other products.

He has been a member of the Communal Bank "Chacoq" for several years. Victor is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that he can pay the workers who pick the fruit off of the trees.

loans.use: to pay the workers who harvest the fruit.

loans.name: Fauzya

texts.en:
Fauzya is 27 years old. She is a married woman and has three children whom she supports. They are aged 12, 9, and 7 years.

Fauzya was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a staff member. She is a taking her first loan from VisionFund Kenya, in the amount of KES 10,000. She runs a café business, which has lasted for one year now. The business is located at Timboni. From it, she earns a monthly income of KES 5,350. She will use the loan to add stock for her business, including vegetables, milk, cereals and soft drinks.

She will use the anticipated profit to expand her café. Her hopes and dreams for her future include expanding her business into a restaurant. In addition, she plans to educate her children, and make sure they live well.

loans.use: to add stock for her business, including vegetables, cereals and soft drinks.

loans.name: Ruth Beatriz

texts.es:
Ruth, se le presenta la necesidad de invertir en su negocio de venta de medicinas, en esta oportunidad comprara más medicina natural y química, para que su inventario este surtido y tenga lo necesario para mantener a sus clientes satisfechos.
Con el préstamo anterior Ruth compro una variedad de medicina mayor, lo que le ayudo a tener sus ventas más altas y mejorar su economía, con las que ha cambiado su estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Ruth needs to invest into her medicine business.  She will buy natural medicines and chemicals so that she can increase her inventory and have what she needs to keep her customers happy.

Ruth used the previous loan to buy a variety of medicine in quantity, which helped her increase her sales, finances, and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy natural medicine.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 52 years old, a male, and married. He has six children, ages 27, 24, 15, 12, 10 and 8 years old whom he supports. He was introduced to Kadet Ltd. by a Kadet officer, and he has a tailoring shop, which has lasted for thirty two years now. In his business, he earns a monthly income of KES 9,312.

He is taking his second loan of KES 30,000, which he intends to use to add stock to his business by buying materials and a machine. Nelson will use the anticipated profits to expand his business. His hopes and dreams for his future business and family are to expand his tailoring shop and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy materials and a machine to make clothes for his customers.

loans.name: Estela Blanca

texts.es:
Estela, se dispone a surtir su inventario para que sus clientes tengan mejores opciones de compra en estas fechas de graduaciones estudiantiles, invertirá en la compra de enchape, cremas corporales y lociones, para contar con la satisfacción de los clientes.
Con el préstamo anterior surtió el inventario de su negocio lo que le ayudo a mejorar sus ventas, atraer nuevos clientes, cancelar su economía y cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Estela is ready to increase her inventory so that her customers will have more options during this graduation season.  She will buy makeup, body creams, and lotions to satisfy her customers.

She used the previous loan to increase her inventory and this helped her increase her sales, attract new customers, and pay off her debts.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Jose Balbino

texts.es:
José, se ha decidido por otro crédito por que ya se está preparando para sembrar y necesita comprar abono, fertilizantes, plaguicidas y pagara mano de obra, de esta manera podrá seguir cultivando sin ningún problema.
Con la inversión que hiso anteriormente le dio como resultado una cosecha abundante y  de buena calidad, sus ingresos mejoraron, su familia está gozando de buena alimentación y salud.
texts.en:
Jose has requested another loan.  He is preparing to plant and needs to buy compost, fertilizer, pesticides, and pay for labor.  In this way he will be able to continue farming with no problems.

His previous investment gave him an abundant and good quality harvest.  His income increased and his family is enjoying good food and health.

loans.use: to buy supplies and pay for labor.

loans.name: Al-Mostaqble Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Mostaqble, and consists of four women who are all hardworking. They live in Sana'a, Yemen. They took out a loan of 200,000 YER. Samira is 25 years old, and she is a married woman. She is a housewife who exerts herself to raise her children to have a good life. She has a strong determination to improve her standards of living.

Due to the high cost of goods, she said she has a small amount of money which she collected herself, but it is not enough to buy her household needs. she has requested a loan of 50,000 YER to buy home appliances to use in her house. She hopes to build a big house and enroll her children in a private school.

loans.use: to buy home appliances to use in her house.

loans.name: Luz Amparo

texts.es:
Amparo tiene 54 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Oyotun , una comunidad que se caracteriza por la preparación de exquisitos platos que los ofrecen en los restaurants de la zona, su población dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, como leche, aceite, arroz, azúcar, gaseosa, artículos de aseo, con más de 10 años de experiencia, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para capital de trabajo, compra de más mercadería por temporada navideña panetones, chocolate de taza, champagne entre otros y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Amparo is 54 years old and lives with her family in the District of Oyotun, a community that is known for preparing exquisite dishes that are served in local restaurants. The people engage in agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. This community is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, which is on the northern coast of Peru.

Amparo sells groceries such as milk, oil, rice, sugar, sodas, and cleaning products. She has more than 10 years of experience. Her business is located in her home. Amparo is requesting a loan of 1,000 PEN that she can use as operating capital. She will buy more merchandise for the Christmas season such as panettones, hot chocolate, champagne, and other products so that she can generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is a married man and a father of six children. He lives with his family in San Miguel, Bohol. Five of his children are grown and the youngest is seven years old.

Romeo earns a living through his sari-sari or retail business selling various goods and items to the people in his area. Romeo is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks, liquor, chips, toiletries, and seasoning. He hopes to make his business successful someday.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, liquor, chips, toiletries, and seasoning

loans.name: Alfa Group

texts.en:
Elsa is the featured borrower of Alfa group, which consists of five Filipino women who decided to put their hands together to acquire a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, which will help them cover their urgent needs.

Elsa is a 44-year-old married mother of four children. She works as a housekeeper to support her family back in the Philippines, especially to make sure that her children are receiving the best education, which she dreams of providing them.

Today, Elsa feels sorry that she isn't next to her beloved children during this time of the year, since she is working hard to provide them with the necessary standards of living. Thus, Elsa is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to send the money to her beloved children back there in the Philippine to enjoy celebrating the Christmas spirit.
  
Elsa is the first from the right. As for the other group members: Mary is the second from the right with light green top, Ma. Ofelia is the lady at the center of the picture with pink top, Annalyn is the second from the left with white top, and Mylen is the first from the left with grey top.

loans.use: to send the money to her beloved children in the Philippines to enjoy celebrating the Christmas spirit.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou, 39 years of age, is married to a farmer and blessed with two children. She manages a direct selling business for almost 20 years, in which she sells personal use products and earns a net income of 4,000 PHP monthly. Her net income is usually spent on their food expenses. Due to insufficient funds she would like to avail a loan amounting to 12,000 PHP to purchase personal use products such as lipsticks, talc powder, lotions, deodorants, pillows and new clothes to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase personal use products such as lipstick, talc powder, lotions, deodorants, pillows and new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en: Carolyn is 31 years old and has two school-age children. She is engaged in cooking and selling meals and snacks and retailing electronic load within her community. Carolyn aims to further improve the business to generate a higher income. But her capital is inadequate, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy more e-load  to sell and fresh vegetables, pork, chicken meat, and seasonings to cook and sell within her local community. She believes that someday she will further improve the business and make it more profitable as she continue to work hard and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables, pork, chicken and seasonings to cook and sell

location.town: Brgy. Ineangan, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Asad

texts.ru: Асад 25 летний мужчина района Шахритус. Он воспитанный сын и верный муж. Асад некоторое время занимался растениеводством, но теперь он хочет параллельно заняться животноводством. Потому что климат и природа района Шахритуса и Республики Таджикистана вполне способствует и благоприятен для таких деятельностей. Асад хочет выкупить бычков из рынка "Искра" и после длительного откорма продать их на том же рынке. Но из-за недостаточных финансовых ресурсов Асад не может начать такой бизнес. Он обратился за помощью. Он просит кредит, чтобы купить бычков и начать деятельность. Он ждет и верит в Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Asad is a 25-year-old man from the Shahrituz region of Tajikistan.  He is a well-mannered son and a faithful husband.  Asad has been a crop farmer for some time already, and would like to start raising livestock as well, seeing as the climate and land in Shahrituz is ideal for it.  For starters, Asad is hoping to buy some bull calves from a market called "Iskra" ("Spark"), which he'll then fatten and sell for a profit.  However, he lacks the necessary money, and is thus seeking a loan to buy some bull calves to start up his business.  He is counting on your support.

loans.use: buy bull calves to set up a new livestock-farming business

loans.name: Nafusi

texts.en:
Nafusi is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives at her own house that neither has piped water nor electricity. 

Nafusi has operated a cosmetics business for the past one year. Her potential customers are women. 

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase body lotion, hair oil, jewelry, chemicals, and hair conditioners for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase body lotion, hair oil, jewelry, chemicals, and hair conditioners for resale.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites helps her husband earn an income by operating their own rice farm, which is their main source of income.  She earns well from the farm and has successfully repaid her previous loans, which she used for farm improvements. Recently, she took another loan from GDMPC to buy organic fertilizer and pesticides. She hopes to gain an abundant harvest so that she may save a portion of her revenue for the education of her children in the future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Twigarukire Group

texts.fr:
Aline fait partie du groupe  Twigarukire  et  habite à Gitega. Elle  a 33 ans et est mariée à Venant. Un commençant. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgé de 3 à 15 ans, dont 3 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de bière de banane depuis 8 ans. 

Elle est à septième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bananes pour avoir beaucoup de bidons de bière de banane  à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait acheter des terrains cultivables et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Aline is part of the Twigarukire group and she lives in Gitega. She is 33 years old and is married to Venant, a storekeeper. Together they have five children who are between 3 and 15 years old, three of them are in school.

She has been selling banana beer for 8 years.

This is her seventh loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan she gets, she will increase her capital and buy a larger quantity of bananas to have more kegs of banana beer to sell and then earn more.

loans.use: to  increase her capital and buy a larger quantity of bananas to have many kegs of banana beer to sell and then earn more.

loans.name: Khary

texts.en: Khary is 18 years old. She is married and lives with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than a year, earning approximately $5 daily. Her husband, who joins her in the picture, is employed in a blacksmith shop. He earns about $5 each day. To improve her family’s finances, Khary is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a taxi service when he is free from his work. By doing so, he would be able to generate additional income for the family. In the future, she would like to build a new house, if possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a taxi service

loans.name: Rose Belinda

texts.en: Rose Belinda is 44 years old and married to Bonifacio. The couple is thankful because they have been blessed with two children. To make a living, Rose Belinda is engaged in a food stall business. She has been in this business for almost ten (10) years. She usually earns a net income of about PHP 400 a day. At this moment, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase meat and vegetable to cook and sell. She hopes to obtain her desired loan to further improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase meat and vegetables for her food stall business

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a 34-year-old man from Kakamega who is a businessman in the same town. He is married to Phyllis. They do not yet have a child.

Denis operates a chemist business, which he has done for the last seven years. He earns a monthly income of 12,000 KES. He is taking his first loan  with Vision Fund Kenya, for 10,000 KES, which he intends to use in expanding his business.

He will plough the profits back into the business and repay the loan. His dream is to become a wholesaler in the medicine sector.

loans.use: To buy more medicines to sell

loans.name: Lito

texts.en:
Lito is a resident from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of eight children. Lito is a scrap buyer, which involves buying and reselling scrap metals, copper wires, and any other recyclable materials from his neighborhood. This is his source of income. 

Lito is asking for a loan to buy more scrap to sell. In the future, Lito hopes to make his business a success and a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more scrap materials to sell

loans.name: Beglar

texts.en:
Beglar, age 45, is from the Khobi district of the western part of Georgia. He is married and has two children. Beglar earns a living through agricultural business, and breeds two milk cows and a calf. In addition, he grows citrus and nuts on a family-owned piece of land.

In order to generate a stable monthly income, Beglar wishes to start a bread bakery in which traditional Georgian bread will be baked. Beglar's wife will work as a baker there and save the costs of hired an employee. They own a commercial space, and now need the money to buy all the needed equipment and raw materials.

Beglar will distribute the bread to the local grocery stores and generate good profit. He hopes his project will be profitable, as he lives in a crowded street and similar bakeries are not located nearby. Beglar awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a bakery in which traditional Georgian bread will be baked.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 24 years old. She is a female, married, and has two children; ages four and two years old respectively whom she supports. She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a KADET staff, and she is taking her second loan of KES 40,000 from KADET. Nancy has a grocery shop which has lasted for five years now, and earns a monthly income of KES 6,050. She will use her loan to buy onions, vegetables, tomatoes, and potatoes. 

She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business are to open multiple groceries and make sure her children get better education.

loans.use: to buy onions, vegetables, tomatoes, and potatoes to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Soyoltsetseg

texts.en: Soyoltsetseg, 34 years old, lives with her brother's family in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a food technologist at a bread factory since 2012. Her brother has the profession of a welder and works at a power plant. Her brother's wife is currently unemployed and stays at home looking after their two children ages 3 and 1 year. The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years and it needs some renovation. So she is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. After the renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a married woman and a mother of three children aged two to seven. Her husband is a farmer. Helen works in her sari-sari store. She sells various goods and items to the people in her area.

Helen is asking for a loan to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks and rice. With this loan, she will be able to improve the variety of her stock, and attract more customers to her store. In the future, Helen hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks and rice

loans.name: Rusudan

texts.en:
Rusudan is 36 years old from the Rustavi district. She has 15-year-old daughter and a mother. Her mother is a tailor and gets orders to sew clothes. Rusudan works as a sales lady at a local zoo shop and gets 600 Georgia Laris (GEL) per month. 

The owner decided to sell the zoo shop, and Rusudan decided to purchase it with the loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $2100 to purchase the shop. She will continue working there and also will be able to increase her income. 

Rududan is very motivated to work hard and ensure her daughter's future. The Start Up program will be a support for the family.

loans.use: to buy the shop where she works

loans.name: Flor De Monimbo Group

texts.es: El grupo está formado por tres socias una de ellas es Karen tiene la edad de 20 años, soltera, su negocio es la venta de  hot dog  y Hamburguesa desde hace 2 años. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de materia prima como es pan de hot dog, pan de hamburguesa, chorizo, salsa de tomate, mostaza, mayonesa, cebolla, lechuga, pepino, queso amarillo, papas, carne de pollo. Maribel tiene 31 años su negocio es la venta de gaseosa desde hace 1 año, Rosibel tiene 33 años su negocio es un taller de talabartería desde hace 10 años.
texts.en:
This group consists of three members. One of them is Karen. She is 20 years old, single, and has a business of selling hot dogs and hamburgers that she has managed for two years. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy supplies such as hot dog buns, hamburger buns, chorizo sausage, tomato sauce, mustard, mayonnaise, onions, lettuce, peppers, yellow cheese, potatoes, and chicken.

Maribel is 31 year old and has been in the business of selling sodas for one year. Rosibel is 33 years old and operated a leather goods workshop for 10 years.

loans.use: to buy hot dog buns, hamburger buns, chorizo sausage, tomato sauce, mustard, mayonnaise, onions, lettuce, peppers, yellow cheese, potatoes, and chicken.

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Soutoura de Koutiala  (Koko) est un regroupement de femmes qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 25 ans, sont mariées et au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, de médicaments traditionnels, de  condiments, de  savons, etc.
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de groupe. 
Fadima 2 eme de la droite vers la gauche est vendeuse de  condiments, Jus etc. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des condiments de diverses sortes. Elle se procure de ces articles  à Koutiala et dans les villages environnants. Elle vend ces articles au comptant à la maison et au marché à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres  du groupe Soutoura comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 160 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Fadima  compte réaliser  184 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Soutoura of Koutiala (Koko) is a group of women living in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. They are on average 25 years old, and are married with at least three children.
This women’s group trades in various items such as traditional medicines, condiments, soap, etc.
To develop their business, the members have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso’s loan program. They are on their fourth group loan. 
Fadima, second from the right, sells condiments, juices, etc. She is planning on using her loan to purchase various types of condiments. She procures these items from Koutiala and nearby villages. She retails these items from home and at the market to a diversified clientele. 
While the other members of group Soutoura are anticipating an average profit of 160,000 XOF each for this cycle, Mrs. Fadima is planning on 184,000 XOF.
In addition to repaying their loans, they use part of the profit to handle their personal expenses and to increase their working capital.

loans.use: to purchase condiments.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda owns and operates a business selling personal cosmetic products such as lotions and perfumes in the local community.  She has been engaged in her business for more than three  years and earns well for the family. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used in buying more stock to sell. Currently, she took a new loan to buy additional cosmetics to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Marissa
