texts.en: Marissa helps her husband manage their motorcycle transport business in the local community to earn a living. After more than seven years in the business, Marissa earns well for the family and has successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC, which she used to buy motorcycle accessories. Currently, she needs to replace the tires. Without hesitation, she took a new loan to buy new tires for the vehicle. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to be able to buy another motorcycle unit.

loans.use: to buy new tires

loans.name: Jose Ines

texts.es:
José Inés tiene 53 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío Las Juntas una comunidad pequeña formada por seis familias situadas cerca al río La Viña que desemboca en el río Marañón, una zona rural del distrito de Santo Tomás, que se caracteriza por sus paisajes verdes, relieve accidentado que le ha permitido desarrollarse mediante la agricultura, principalmente cultivo de café, frutales entre otros, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Cutervo, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de café tiene sembrado 2 ha de su propiedad, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 20 años, también se dedica al cultivo de piña, tiene una familia unida que se esfuerza en la labor que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono para sus cultivos, para ofrecer a sus clientes una buena producción y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
José Inés is 53 years old, and he lives with his wife and children in the village of Las Juntas, a small community made up of six families. It is situated near the La Viña River, which flows into the Marañón River, in a rural area within the district of Santo Tomás.

This area is characterized by its green landscapes and rugged terrain, which has made development possible through agriculture--mainly coffee, fruit, and other crops--trade, and cattle raising . It is located in the Cutervo Province, which lies within the Cajamarca Region in Peru’s northern sierra.

He has been a farmer for 20 years; mainly growing coffee, which he has planted on two hectares of his land, and he also grows pineapples. He has a united family who put a lot of effort into their work.

He has requested a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy fertilizer for his crops, so that he can offer his customers a good production.  In this way, he will generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is married to a farmer who owns a rice farm. The farm is the family’s main source of income. She has helped her husband work on the farm for more than eight years, earning a good income for the family. 

She took a new loan from GDMPC, which she has joined recently, to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides to improve the farm. They are determined to be successful in farming so that they can provide a better standard of living for the entire family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides

loans.name: Syafrudin

texts.en: Syafrudin and other four family members live together in a family home in Serang, a suburban area located about three hours from Jakarta, the capital city. Syafrudin is a single man who manages a small stall called a "warung" that sells snacks, drinks, groceries, and mobile phone airtime credits. He joined Ruma because he wanted to improve his business so he can put aside the extra money for family savings. Syafrudin hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva because he sees more opportunities to boost up these transactions, especially on weekends. For the last three months, his average sales were about $30 - $31 per day just from selling mobile phone airtime credits. He also seeks other business opportunities for the future, such as processing bill payments for his customers. In the photo, Syafrudin is standing in his stall. Syafrudin thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits on weekends

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine is from the Darakert village of Ararat region. She is a farmer with 10 years of experience running a farm. Lusine, together with her husband, has been involved in farming and agriculture, and that's the main source of income for their family. 

The family owns a greenhouse which is too old and needs to be renovated. Because of hard financial conditions, they aren't able to renovate it, and that's the reason Lusine has applied for this loan. She is asking for a loan of USD $1,500 to be able to purchase seeds for cultivation and to renovate the greenhouse. 

Lusine has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to return it back. However, thanks to her hard work during the recent times, Lusine was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for greenhouse renovations and seeds

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Tièssiri est un regroupement de 5 femmes de Koutiala du quartier Sogomougou  qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans, sont mariées et au moins 7 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes de Koutiala fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, condiments, Jus,  Sucre, Légumes, Fruits, Savon et divers etc. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur huitième prêt de groupe.   
Saoudatou est un membre du groupe Tièssiri de Koutiala, assise au milieu, elle est vendeuse de pastèques, Bananes plantains et compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des Pastèques et bananes enfin de satisfaire sa  clientèle. Elle se procure de ces marchandises  à Koutiala et à Koury, elle vend au comptant à la maison et au marché à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Tièssiri comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 130 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Saoudatou compte réaliser  145 000FCFA.   
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter leur fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Tiessiri is a group of five women from Koutiala, from the Sogomougou neighborhood. They live in   large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. They are on average 40 years old, and are married with at least seven children.

This women’s group from Koutiala trades in various items such as condiments, juices, sugar, vegetables, soap, and miscellaneous other items. To grow their business, the members have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso’s loan program. They are on their eighth group loan.

Saoudatou is a member of group Tiessiri of Koutiala. Sitting in the middle, she sells watermelons, plantains, and is planning on using her loan to purchase watermelons and plantains to satisfy demand from her clients. She procures her merchandise in Koutiala and in Koury, and retails from her home and at the market to a variety of customers.

While the other members of group Tiesseri are anticipating a monthly average profit of 130,000 XOF each this cycle, Mrs. Saoudatou is planning on 145,000 XOF.

In addition to repaying their loans, they use part of the profit to handle their personal expenses and to increase their working capital.

loans.use: purchase fruits.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 44-year-old man from Kakamega. He is married to Lucy, who is a domestic farmer in the same county. They have four children, ages 21, 18, 14, and nine years old.

He operates a photo studio business, which he has done for the last 17 years, earning an income of KES 14,000 per month. He is taking his first loan of KES 10,000 with Vision fund Kenya to use in a buying a digital camera. 

The profits thereafter will be used to buy the current equipment and repay his loan. His dream is to open a bigger studio with digital equipment.

loans.use: to buy a digital camera.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy canned food and soft drinks which will allow her to fill her clients' orders on time.

loans.name: Aun

texts.en: Aun is 36 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than three years, earning approximately $6 daily. Her husband, who joins her in the picture, is a construction worker who makes an income of $7 each day. Due to a lack of funds, Aun is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase construction materials to fix her house. By doing so, she would be able to provide better living conditions. In the future, she would like to expand her husband’s work to be a construction foreman and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to fix her house

loans.name: Annastacia

texts.en: Annastacia is a 25-year-old married woman. She has one child who is 7 months old, who she supports. She was introduced to KADET Ltd by aKadet officer and she has a retail shop (Mali Mali) . She has been in this business for three years. From her business, she earns a monthly income of ksh.11,050. She is taking her first loan of ksh.20,000 which she intends to use for buying utensils and clothes for her shop. Annastacia will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her business and family are to open a wholesale shop and to educate her child.

loans.use: to buy utensils and clothes to her buyers.

loans.name: Leap

texts.en: Leap is 57 years old. She is married and resides with her child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling bananas for more than 10 years, earning approximately $6 daily. Her husband who is joining her in the picture is a farmer. He makes an income of $2 each day. Her child is employed in a clothes store and earns about $5 per day. To improve her family’s finances, Leap is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase bananas to resell. By doing so, she would be able to generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a fence around her house.

loans.use: to purchase bananas to resell

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJEKAFO est composé de femmes mariées qui ont en moyenne 36 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, commune de Guégnaka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiments, des produits cosmétiques, des chaussures en caoutchouc, de l’habillement, des savons et du charbon de bois.  .                                                               
Les femmes du groupe DJEKAFO sont à leur neuvième prêt solidaire. La cliente AMI  la deuxième personne à partir de la droite est vendeuse de savon. Elle compte acheter du savon concentré avec les grossistes qui sera dilué et ensuite mis dans les bidons.  Le savon est vendu en détail à une clientèle mixte. Elle  compte réaliser un bénéfice de 30000 FCFA par mois. Le bénéfice mensuel est réinjectée dans l’activité.
texts.en:
Group Djekafo is composed of married women who are on average 36 years old with three children. They all live in traditional families in the city of Fana, Guegnaka township, Dioila prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region in the Republic of Mali).

They met through relations of family, neighborhood, and friendship. They work in food service or retail condiments, cosmetics, rubber shoes, clothing, soap, and charcoal. The women of group Djekafo are on their ninth solidarity loan.

Ami, the second client from the right, sells soap. She is planning on purchasing concentrated soap from wholesalers, to be diluted and packaged in tins. The soap is retailed to a mixed-gender clientele. She is forecasting a monthly profit of 30,000 XOF. The monthly profit is then reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to purchase soap.

loans.name: Shukufa

texts.en:
Shukufa is a freshman in the Human Rights program, this is her story: 

I am from Dushanbe, the capital of Tajikistan. Tajikistan is an unstable and backwards country. Many of the women I know are not able to go to school or have a career. I believe that human rights should be protected regardless of gender, and that is why I chose the human rights program at AUCA. 

The Soviet Union had many problems, but in Tajikistan it provided education for both men and women as equals. Since the 1990s, that system of education has collapsed, and has not been replaced. The result is that everyone, but especially women, have less access to education, which is the one thing that can help them live a meaningful life.

I want to study at AUCA because it is the most respected university in the region, and provides me with the opportunity to study human rights and bring those skills back to Tajikistan. I want to live in a country where all women are able to freely express their thoughts without fear.

loans.use: to pay for higher education tuition

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUISSEME est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, commune de Guégnaka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration (galettes), le commerce de condiments, de haricot, de céréales et de tubercules. Les femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME sont à leur neuvième prêt solidaire. La cliente Fatoumata   la première personne assise à gauche est vendeuse de galette. Elle compte acheter 100 kg de haricot, 40 litres d’huile et 4 chargements de charrette en bois de chauffe. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 17500 FCFA par mois. Le bénéfice mensuel est réinjectée dans l’activité.
texts.en: The Djiguisseme group is composed of married women averaging 36 years of age, with three children. They all live in traditional families in the town of Fana, Guekna commune, Diola prefecture, Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of Mali). They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They cook food for sale (pancakes), and also sell condiments, beans, cereals and tubers. The group members are on their ninth solidarity loan. Our client Fatoumata is the first one seated on the left; she sells pancakes. She plans to buy 100 kg [220 lbs] of beans, 40 liters [10.5 gallons] of oil and four cartloads of firewood. She plans to earn a revenue of 175,000 West African francs per month. She will reinvest the revenue in her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making pancakes.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a 29-year-old woman from the town of Loon, Bohol. She is married with four children who are between two and eight years old. She has been engaged in selling Avon products like perfume, colognes, shampoo, lotion and clothing for four years now. Her husband works as a habal-habal driver (motorcycle transport) and does not earn enough for them. She is asking for a loan to buy more stocks of Avon lotion, body talc, perfume and clothing to resell. Her loan will help boost her business and provide for her family for food and school fees. 

In the future, she hopes to have a bigger income and another source of business so she can support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of Avon lotion, body talc, perfume and clothing to resell

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is married and is earning a living in her retail business selling different kinds of products in her village. Her husband works as a government employee. She has been in her business for more than six years earning enough to fulfill her family's needs. 

She took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional cosmetics, ready-to-wear clothes, and plastic wares to sell. She is determined to improve her business and make it a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional cosmetics, ready-to-wear clothes, and plastic wares to sell

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is a married woman with five children from San Miguel, Bohol. For three years now, she has been buying empty sacks that she repairs and then sells to her customers. These empty sacks are from rice and feed packing. This is her main source of income. 

Zosima is asking for a loan to buy more sacks to repair and sell to increase her income. Zosima hopes to make her business successful and sustainable. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more sacks to repair and sell

loans.name: Imron

texts.en:
Imron and his family live together in a family home in Serang, a suburban area located about three hours from Jakarta, the capital city. Imron is a private worker who also manages a small stall called a "warung" that sells snacks, drinks, groceries, and mobile phone airtime credits. He joined Ruma because he wanted to improve his business. Imron thinks that by joining Ruma, he can expand his network with other business owners so he can gain more business knowledge. 

Imron hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva because he sees more opportunities to boost his transactions, especially on weekends. For the last three months, his average sales were about $66 - $68 per day, just from selling mobile phone airtime credits. He also seeks other business opportunities in the future, such as processing bill payments for his customers. In the photo, Imron is standing in front of his stall. Imron thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits on weekends

loans.name: Baasanjav

texts.en:
Mr. Baasanjav, 55 years old, lives with his wife and two children in a traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling) in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He has been working as a sentry at a private firm for four years. On his day off, he provides taxi services to local people. He and his wife both have retired from government work and receive state pensions. Their elder son works at a construction site as an Engineer's Assistant. 

Mr. Baasanjav is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to buy a natural gas vehicle for his taxi business, because his old taxi is out of service. The natural gas vehicle wastes less fuel compared to other types of cars and has the advantage of releasing fewer pollutants. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy a natural gas vehicle

loans.name: Hawaisah

texts.en: Hawaisah lives in Bogor, a suburban area located about an hour from Jakarta. She is married and has three children, two of whom are going to public schools. She is an entrepreneur who runs a small canteen that sells Indonesian food. Hawaisah wanted to add another source of income for her family even though her husband is working in a private company. She joined Ruma because she was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credits with support and assistance from Ruma agents. For the last three months, she has had around $34 - $35 per day in sales just from selling mobile phone airtime credits. She hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva as sales on weekends are usually higher than on weekdays. Hawaisah plans to seek more business opportunities in the future, such as processing bill payments for her customers. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits on weekends

loans.name: Vicky Ann

texts.en: Vicky Ann is married and provides for the needs of her family with her business. She has been selling groceries in her retail store for four years, and she is now also engaged in selling food in her cafeteria. She borrowed a new loan to buy raw ingredients in order to prepare and sell food in her village. She is hopeful to gain more income to have a better living in the near future.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for her cafeteria

loans.name: Ramatoulaye

texts.fr:
Madame Ramatoulaye, a pratiquement démarré son élevage avec les crédits empruntés à l’IMCEC. Car c’est en 2007 qu’il a obtenu son premier crédit avec lequel, il a acheté une bande de 50 poussins pour  élever et revendre, il a aussi fait de la vente de tissus. Le crédit lui servira à renouveler cette activité. Elle a donc acquise une expérience de plus de cinq ans dans ce domaine d’activité. Ramatoulaye est mariée et mère de 2 enfants, elle vit avec ses parents et participe à la dépense quotidienne. Grâce aux bénéfices, elle peut gérer la scolarité de ses enfants en appuyant son mari dans les charges scolaires. 
Ramatoulaye a comme ambition d’ouvrir un jour, une mini-boutique dans la maison.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ramatoulaye has literally started her breeding business with loans from IMCEC. It is indeed in 2007 that she was granted her first loan, with which she purchased a clutch of 50 chicks to raise and resell. She also sells fabrics. She will use the loan to restart her business. She has gained over five years of experience in her domain.

Ramatoulaye is married and a mother of two; she lives with her parents and contributes to daily expenses. Thanks to her profits, she can manage to send her children to school by supporting her husband with school expenses.

Ramatoulaye’s ambition is one day to open a mini-store in her house.

loans.use: buy chicks to raise and resell, and to buy fabric.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is a second time borrower with Ugafode microfinance ltd (MDI), applying for a loan of eight hundred thousands shillings (800,000). She is married with 2 children and rents a trading centre in the city outskirts where she runs a small grocery. This has enabled her earn some income in order to support her family and acquire a small stand within the same trading centre. 

Justine wants to buy more bananas and a few iron sheets to complete her residential house, but is constrained by limited income, thus applying for a loan. She says that she plans to pay off this second loan successfully and request another in the future so as to continue developing her business and household.

loans.use: to buy bananas and iron sheets.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a married woman and a mother of 10 children. She is a farmer and has been in the farming business for several years now. Lourdes works hard to support her husband in tilling their farm. 

Lourdes is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of their farm as well as their yield and income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of clothing to offer for sale.

Nenita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing this new loan for Nenita in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of clothing to offer for sale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married with children aged 19 to 28 years old. Her family lives in San Miguel, Bohol. She has been engaged in a farming business with her husband for several years now. Susan helps her husband till their fields.

As of now, Susan is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the farm. With this loan, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm thus increasing her yield and income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina manages her own farm while her husband is earning income working as a driver. She has been growing and harvesting corn for more than seven years and she earns enough to sustain her family's living. 

She took a loan from GDMPC micro finance to buy fertilizer and seedlings for corn production. She wants to see her children finish their studies so they can have a successful and better living in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for corn production

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia manages the family farm while her husband works as a carpenter to make a living. She has been growing and harvesting corn for more than five years earning well for the family. 

She joined GDMPC in 2013 and has borrowed a loan to buy fertilizer in order to boost their farm production. She hopes to earn higher returns from the farm to improve their living situation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Khvicha

texts.en:
Khvicha is from the Kakheti Region in the district of Gurjaani. He is 42 years old. Khvicha lives with his pensioner mother, brother, and his family. 

The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a vineyard and a plot of land, where different kinds of fruits are grown. In addition, they have a tractor to cultivate the land and a truck to transport cargo to different destinations. Khvicha decided to start his own business and requested a loan.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $5000 to purchase a stock of seeds. As the seeds are purchased, he will start a trading business. He will purchase seeds at wholesale prices and then resell them with a price mark-up. This will increase the income of the family and Khvicha will be able to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to begin trading seeds.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is 23 years old, female and married. She has one child, 2 1/2 years old, whom she supports. She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a KADET officer, and she has a clothes shop. She has been in this business for three years and it is located at Timboni. In her business, she earns a monthly income of 8,950 KES (Kenyan shillings). 

She is taking her third loan of 30,000 KES, which she intends to use for adding stock to her business by buying more clothes and shoes. Saumu will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her business and family are to open a boutique and educate her child.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Obdolia

texts.en:
Obdolia is 49 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is in school.

Obdolia is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Obdolia requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Obdolia has been farming vegetables for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Obdolia would like to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is married with two children. She helps her husband on their farm, which is their main source of income to make a living. She has been doing this for eight years, and she earns well for the family. 

She took a new loan from GDMPC Micro Finance to buy fertilizer and pay for weeding maintenance costs. She wants to improve their farm in order to gain more income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for weeding maintenance

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en: Rosalita is operating her own retail store in her village to make a living. She has been selling grocery goods and other products for more a year, and she earns well for the family needs. She took a new loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to to buy additional grocery goods and cosmetics to sell. She wants to sustain her business and improve it for a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Manuel Javier

texts.es:
Manuel, se ve en la necesidad de invertir nuevamente en la compra por mayor de huevos, para seguir cubriendo los pedidos de sus clientes, ya que desea seguir ampliando su negocio.
El capital que se le proporciono anteriormente se ayudo a poder responder a la demanda que tenía en su momento, sus ventas aumentaron y a cancelado sus deudas, así como también ofrece a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel sees the need to invest into his business once again and buy eggs in quantity so he can continue to meet his customer demand.  He wants to expand his business.

The previous loan helped him respond to his previous demand, his sales increased, he paid off his debts, and the quality of life improved for his family.

loans.use: to buy eggs.

loans.name: Minu

texts.en:
Minu is 43 years old. She is married and has two children aged 21 and 16. In 2000, she established her pickle making business. She supports her family by working 7 hours a day, 7 days a week. 

Minu has already received and successfully repaid eight loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy food material for her business. In the future, Minu plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy food material for her business.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is 48 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamiz City. He is married with three school-age children.
  
Edgar has a furniture business which earns approximately 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month of doing this type of business. He has requested a loan to buy raw materials for furniture making.

Edgar has been a member of PMPC for one month. In the future, Edgar hopes to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for furniture making

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of cassava, maize, beans, and fish, thus increasing her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 50 years old and married with three children.

Clarita is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Clarita requested a 19,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Clarita has been farming rice for 12 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva, to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel, está solicitando capital para invertir en la compra de abono, fertilizantes, semilla y plaguicidas, ya que son los insumos necesarios para obtener una buena cosecha y seguir creciendo en su negocio.
Con el crédito anterior pudo sembrar y cosechar granos de una calidad mayor, aumento sus ventas y su economía ha mejorado. Se encuentra muy saludable y con mucha disponibilidad para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Fidel is asking for a loan to buy compost, fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides, as these are the supplies he needs to have a good harvest and continue growing his business.

The previous loan allowed him to plant and harvest quality grains and his sales and financial situation improved.  He is healthy and available to keep working.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, a young man aged 27, is married with three children. John operates a video library in Lyantonde town. He is hard working and honest. His business has managed to break even because there are few competitors in the area and there are few television stations in the town.

John wants the loan to buy a new computer for burning CDs. The one he is currently using is outdated and does not have a large enough memory to store music.

loans.use: to buy a new computer.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with three children, two at school and one who is an adult. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past two years, she has operated a food stall business, preparing various foods such as rice, flatbread and beans to sell to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase wheat flour, rice, beans, cooking oil and charcoal for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, rice, beans, cooking oil and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with four children who attend school, which is the reason for her hard work. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. 

Rehema operates a cafe business, making staples like rice, tea, beans and chapati (flatbread) for sale to passersby and neighbors. She cited seasonality as a major challenge.

With the 15,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase stock of goods, maize flour, wheat flour, rice and drinks for the business. Her dream is to see her children get a better education and become important people in the society.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods, maize flour, wheat flour, rice and drinks for the business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in 2012, and she appreciates the programs, services, and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000. This loan is intended to buy stocks of dried fish to sell.
Elizabeth dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is married with three children, and she manages her own general store to make a living. She has been selling goods in her village for many years, and she earns well for the family. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She wants to sustain her business and wants to expand it in order to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 37 years old, married with four children, and a resident of Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She has earned a living through retail goods for 11 years. Her store is located at her own house, where she sells a variety of basic commodities and dry goods items.

She has been a member of PMPC for three years and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative provides. Now, she is applying a loan of Php 14,000 to buy stocks of goods for store and dry goods to sell.

Lolita deeply wishes to maintain being a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to buy stocks of goods for her store and dry goods to sell

loans.name: Jimna

texts.en:
Jimna is from Lagag, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is happily married with four children. For five years, she has sold food for a living to support the needs of her family.

In 2011, Jimna applied for membership with PMPC. Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligation in a timely manner.

Recently, Jimna is asking for financial assistance of Php 5,000  to purchase goods for her snack vending business. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and expand her business. She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative, and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her snack vending business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothing to sell

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.en:
Arnulfo is a married man and a father of three children, aged 16, 12 and 8 respectively. Arnulfo lives with his family in the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. He is engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store business, selling various goods and items to the people in his place.

He is asking for a loan to buy soda and beverages, rice, canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, cooking ingredients and seasonings. With this loan, he will be able to improve the variety of his stock, thus attracting more buyers. In the future, Arnulfo has hopes of making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy soda and beverages, rice, canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, cooking ingredients and seasonings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fish to smoke, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase maize

loans.name: Fadhili

texts.en:
Fadhili is a married woman with two children, one underage and the other in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling clothes for both men and women. She cites stiff competition as her major challenge in the business. 

Fadhili is requesting 10,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia is 59 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Nemia has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Nemia requested a 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Nemia has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, Nemia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Daisy Jhoana

texts.es: Ella es daisy, esta interesada en estudiar auxiliar de enfermeria para un futuro mejor, para ella y para la hija, ella despues de estar graduada como auxiliar quiere seguri estudiando y a si poder conseguir un trabajo formal, ella quiere costiarse los propios estudios, ya que trabaja en un microempresa de sacos y tejidos y un poco de la ayuda de la mmadre, esta intersada en el convenio ya que para ella es una grana yuda porla situacion economica, ella esta muy animada,  muy contenta ya se esta presentando laoportunidad de estudiar, ya que ella habia dejado los estudios por situacion economica y por el bebe.
texts.en:
She is Daisy.  She is interested in studying assistant nursing for a better future for her and her daughter.

After having graduated as an assistant she wants to continue studying so that she can get formal employment.  She wants to support her own studies since she works in a small business for sacks and fabric and a little help from her mother.

She is interested in the agreement since for her it is a huge help to her economic situation.  She is very energetic, very happy now having been presented with the opportunity to study, since she had left her studies for financial reasons and because of her baby.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of enrollment in school.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sandals and undergarments for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more maize, gari, beans, and groundnuts for resale.

loans.name: Ailene

texts.en:
Ailene is 41 years old, a widow and resident of Datu Tangkilan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She earns a living through her "okay-okay" (used clothing) business.

She has been a member of PMPC for a good number of years and enjoys the privileges being a member of the cooperative. Now she is applying for a loan of PHP 35,000 to purchase stock bundles to sell.

Ailene deeply wishes to maintain being a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase stock bundles to sell.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIESSIRI est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, commune de Guégnaka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration,  de l’habillement, des savons et de tubercules. Les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. La cliente ADIARATOU  la personne assise à droite  est vendeuse de pagne wax. Elle compte acheter 15 pagnes wax avec les grossistes. Les pagnes sont vendus à une clientèle mixte au marché de Fana. Elle  compte réaliser un bénéfice de 20000 FCFA par mois. Le bénéfice mensuel est réinjectée dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Tiessiri group is comprised of married women who, on average, are 36 years old and have three children. They all live in traditional families in the city of Fana, in the village of Guegnaka, in Dioïla prefecture, in the region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

They know one another through family, neighbors, and friendship. They sell food, clothing, soaps, and tubers. This is the second group loan for the women of the Tiessiri group. The client, Adiartou, standing at right, sells "pagnes wax" (traditional wraparounds). She would like to by 15 pagnes wax from wholesalers. The pagnes are sold to a mixed clientele at the Fana market.

She would like to earn a monthly income of 20,000 FCFA. The monthly income is put back into the business.

loans.use: buy clothing.

loans.name: Maria Re

texts.en:
Maria Re joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in 2013, and she appreciates the programs, services, and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000. This loan is intended to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and other farming tools.
Maria Re dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and other farming tools

location.town: SINDANGAN - LAGAG, SINDANGAN, ZAMBOANGA DEL NORTE

loans.name: Veronico

texts.en:
Veronico earns a living through his sari-sari or variety store in his place in Trinidad, Bohol. He sells various goods and items to the people in his area. 
Veronico is in need of additional capital for his store. He is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like noodles, canned goods, soda and beverages, and soap and toiletries. With this, he will be able to improve his stocks, thus allowing him to attract more buyers. In the future, Veronico hopes to make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of goods to sell like noodles, canned goods, soda and beverages, and soap and toiletries

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used buy more fruits and vegetables. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Esperanza hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams that her children will have stable jobs. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more fruits and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Tujijure A Group

texts.fr:
Jacques fait partie du groupe  Tujijure A  et  habite à Gitega. Il  a 48 ans et est marié à Sophie. Une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants, dont 5 étudient.

Il fait le commerce des habits  depuis 15 ans. 

Il est à quatorzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’habits  à revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Jacques is a member of the Tujijure A group and lives in Gitega. He is 48 years old and married to Sophie, who is a grower. Together they have 6 children, 5 of whom attend school. 

Jacques has been in the business of selling clothing for 15 years. He is on his 14th loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan he obtains, he will increase his business capital and purchase many clothes to resell, in order to increase his profits.

loans.use: to increase his business capital and purchase many clothes to resell to increase his profits

loans.name: Muturirwa Group

texts.fr:
Yanuary  fait partie du groupe  Muturirwa et  habite à Rumonge. Il  a 49 ans et est marié à Evelyne, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 8 enfants âgés de 3 à 23 ans dont 6 étudient.
Il prend soins de sa sœur.

Il fait le commerce de  l’huile de palme depuis 19 ans. 

Il est à son huitième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et louer un champ de palmerais, pour avoir  une grande quantité de noix de palme afin de produire une grande quantité d’huile de palme à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait acheter un terrain de cultivable  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Yanuary is a member of the Muturirwa group and lives in Rumonge. He is 49 years old and married to Evelyne, a shopkeeper. Together they ahve 8 children between the ages of 3 and 23, 6 of whom attend school. Yanuary also takes care of his sister.

He has been in the business of selling palm oil for 19 years. He is on his eighth loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan he obtains, he will increase his business capital and rent a palm tree field, in order to have a large quantity of palm nuts to produce a large quantity of palm oil to resell, in order to increase his profits. 

In the coming years, Yanuary would like to purchase a field to farm and to see his children educated.

loans.use: to increase his business capital and rent a palm tree field, in order to have a large amount of palm nuts in order to produce a large quantity of palm oil to resell and increase his profits

loans.name: Emilie

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Emelie works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling spices in the Philippines. Emelie is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell to customers.

Emelie has been sustaining her business activities through the past eleven loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy spices to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.fr:
Né en Avril 1987 à Sienso dans le cercle de San dans une famille de cultivateur,  IBRAHIM a vite embrassé les activités génératrices de revenus. Il est marié à une épouse et  est père de 4 enfants. 
Son magasin se trouve  à San aux abords de la  gare routière. Il s’est spécialisé dans la vente de téléphones portables et accessoires en gros et en détail . Il mène cette activité  y’a plus de 6  ans . Il est très sollicité lors  des foires hebdomadaires de San  ville et environnants.  
Pour diversifier son activité, il décida de faire recours à 
l‘institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso.   Il est à son 6 eme prêt  individuel. IBRAHIM compte acheter un stock important de téléphones portables de toutes marques et accessoires. Il s’approvisionne   auprès des commerçants grossistes à Bamako. Il vend à  San et dans les foires hebdomadaires à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, à crédit et au comptant. 
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qu’il envisage utiliser pour rembourser le prêt, payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants, acheter la nourriture et améliorer sa condition de vie amélioré sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Born in April 1987 in Sienso in the San area to a farming family, Ibrahim quickly learned how to operate a business. He is married and the father of 4 children. His shop is located along the road in San.

Ibrahim specializes in the sale of mobile telephones, both in wholesale and retail. He has been in this business for more than 6 years. He is much sought after in the open air markets of the city of San and its surroundings. 

In order to diversify his business, Ibrahim decided to partner with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his sixth individual loan. He plans to purchase a large stock of mobile telephones of all brands and accessories.

Ibrahim stocks up from wholesalers in Bamako. He sells his products in San and in the open air markets to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash and for credit. He hopes to earn a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA which he will use to repay the loan, to pay for his children's education, to purchase food and to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones and accessories

loans.name: Norberto

texts.en: Norberto is married and is earning money through his motorcycle transport business providing transportation and motor rental in their village to make a living. He borrowed a new loan to cover the costs for license renewal and to purchase accessories. He wants to earn more income to build his own house for his family.

loans.use: to new his license and purchase accessories.

location.town: Western Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of kitchen supplies, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase his capital and purchase 200kg of rice, 100kg of beans, and 50kg of sugar to resell to increase his profits

loans.name: Baltazar

texts.es: Baltazar se siente alegre por el apoyo brindado y por el préstamo porque le ayudo a incrementar el capital del negocio,  él continua con dedicándose a la agricultura, al ganado y a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas, chanchos y otros, él requiere el préstamo para comprar ganado. (La comunidad de Pilco – Grande está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo en el  departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en: Baltazar feels happy about the support given to him and the loan because it helped him to increase the capital of his business. He continues to make a living from agriculture, raising livestock, and raising minor species, such as guinea pigs, hens, and pigs. He needs the loan in order to purchase cattle. (The community of Pilco-Grande is located in the Huayllabamba district of the Paucartambo province, in the department of Cusco, Peru).

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Maria Felonila

texts.es:
María Felonila tiene 46 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos menores en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica al comercio, ganadería y agricultura, es una comunidad que se caracteriza por ser hospitalaria, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 200 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Felonila is 46 years old. She lives with her young children in Oyotún, a community supported by agriculture, livestock raising and markets. It is community that is known for its hospitality, located two hours from the city of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

She earns a living raising and selling small animals. Her business is located in her home. She has requested a loan for 1200 New Puervian Soles to buy animal feed to fatten her animals. This will allow her to offer better quality to her customers, thus increasing her family's income.

loans.use: to buy animal feed to fatten her animals.

loans.name: Vahasi Group

texts.fr:
Etienne fait partie du groupe  Vahasi  et  habite à Bujumbura. Il  a 39 ans et est marié à Annociate. Une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant  de 1 an.

Il fait le commerce des habits depuis 22  ans. 

C’est son premier crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’habits  à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait être importateur des habits,ouvrir une boutique et voir ses enfants. étudier.
texts.en:
Etienne is a member of the Vahasi group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 39 years old and married to Annociate, a grower, Together they have a one-year-old child. 

Etienne has been selling clothes for 22 years. This is his first loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan that he obtains, he will increase his capital and purchase many articles of clothing to resell and increase his profits. 

In the coming years, Etienne would like to be a clothing importer and open a shop, and to see his children educated.

loans.use: to increase his capital and purchase clothing to resell, in order to increase his profits

loans.name: Garukirabakenyezi Group

texts.fr:
Françoise fait partie du groupe  Garukirabakenyezi  et  habite à Gitega. Elle  a  44 ans et est mariée à Ndikumana un mécanicien. 

Elle fait le commerce de bananes  depuis 20 ans. 

Elle est à son  vingt-et -unième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bananes à revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Françoise is a member of the Garukirabakenyezi group and lives in Gitega. She is 44 years old and married to Ndikumana, a mechanic.

Françoise has been selling bananas for 20 years. She is on her twenty-first loan with Turame.

With the Kiva loan that she obtains, Françoise will increase her capital and purchase a large quantity of bananas to resell and increase her profits.

loans.use: to increase her capital and purchase a large quantity of bananas to resell to increase her profits

loans.name: Ben Group

texts.fr:
Les Femmes du groupe  Ben de Koutiala   se connaissent bien et  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, Fruits et Légumes, huile, Bois de chauffe, Produits Cosmétiques, divers,  etc. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur septième prêt de groupe. 
Maimouna, accroupie à droite sur la photo à côté de sa tasse d’orange, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des fruits (orange et bananes) pour satisfaire sa clientèle. Elle se procure de ces produits dans les vergers et jardin autour de Koutiala. Elle les vend au comptant à la maison et au marché à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres  du groupe Ben comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 90 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Maimouna  compte réaliser  110 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Ben group from Koutiala know one another well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. On average, they are 34 years old, married, and have at least five children. 

This group of women sells various articles such as fruits and vegetables, oil, firewood, cosmetic products, etc. In order to grow their businesses, the members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. This is their seventh group loan. 

Maimouna, crouching at the right of the photo next to her plate of oranges, plans on using her loan to buy fruits (oranges and bananas) in order to satisfy her clientele. She buys her supplies in the orchards and gardens around Koutiala. She sells them for credit out of her home and in the market to a diverse clientele. 

While each of the other members of the Ben group would like to earn an average monthly profit of 90,000 FCFA during this loan cycle, Madame Maimouna would like to earn 110,000 FCFA.

In addition to the loan reimbursement, they would like to use a part of their revenue to pay for personal expenses and grow their business.

loans.use: buy fruit.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  DJEKAFO  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 20ans, 2enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FAKOLA, une des -préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment. Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution.
Mme MAMOU  (1ère à droite sur la photo) compte acheter avec son prêt 4 sacs d’atieké. Elle vend quotidiennement à FAKOLA et est très sollicitée surtout le jour de foire.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15 000FCFA.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Djekafo group are married women, who, on average, are 20 years old and have two children. They all live in polygamous families in Fakola - one of the prefectures of the third administrative region of Mali. 

They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully run their businesses at all times. This is their first loan with the institution. 

With her loan, Madame Mamou (at right in the photo) would like to buy four bags of "atieke," a type of couscous made of fermented manioc. She sells daily in Fakola and is sought after on market days.

She would like to earn an average monthly profit of 15,000 FCFA. This income will allow her to pay her loan and help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: buy "atieke," a type of couscous made of fermented manioc.

loans.name: Masis

texts.en:
Masis lives in Kapan town. He lives there with his parents and has been involved in beekeeping for many years. Masis currently keeps 17 colonies of bees. With the help of his mother, Masis gets high quality honey and sells to local re-sellers. Masis perfectly manages to earn a living for his parents with the beekeeping business.

Because of high costs that the family faces daily, it is very difficult for Masis to save money to increase the number of bees. Therefore, that is the reason he has applied for this loan. The requested loan of USD 1,500 will give a great opportunity to Masis to purchase 15 colonies of bees and enlarge the production of honey. 

Masis will be able to gather more income for his parents.

loans.use: to pay for 15 colonies of bees.

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es:
José es un joven de 20 años de edad, estudio hasta  noveno grado. Es casado y ha procreado un hijo de dos años de edad;  la esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

José se dedica a la apicultura desde hace 5 años, esto lo aprendió del hermano que se dedica a este oficio. Antes solo se dedicaba a la agricultura, pero el hermano lo invitaba a que fueran a alimentar las abejas del vecino y el con miedo decidió ir,  ya que le tenía mucho miedo a las avispas pero luego se le quito el miedo y es así como se dedica a esto y ve que le pagan bien entonces sigue en este oficio, lo hace desde las dos de la tarde a las cinco de la tarde.  

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar dos novillas,  ya que el cuñado le ha prestado un lote para que las pueda tener y ya analizo la situación y ve que le será de mucha utilidad, ya que es una buena oportunidad para que el comience hacerse de ganado y de unas vaquitas para que le den leche y es otra fuente de ingreso para la familia. Este préstamo vendrá a mejorar mucho su vida, ya que es una muy buena oportunidad y no la desaprovechara.

Los sueños que tiene es poder tener su propio negocio de las abejas, ya que eso es un negocio muy bueno que  genera muchos ingresos y su familia estará muy bien.
texts.en:
José is a 20-year-old young man. He studied until ninth grade. He is married and has a two-year-old son. His wife does the household chores.

José has worked in bee-keeping for 5 years. He learnt this from his brother, who also works in this job. Before that, José only worked in agriculture, but his brother asked him to feed the bees of their neighbor with him, and he decided to go although he was very much afraid of the bees. Afterwards, he lost his fear and so he now works in this job. He realized that it is well-paid and therefore he continued with it. He works from two to five o’clock in the afternoon.

He is asking for a loan to buy two heifers because his brother-in-law has given him a plot where he could keep them. He thought about the situation and thinks that this will be very useful for him. It is a great opportunity to start raising livestock and to have a couple of cows which will give milk, and this will be another source of income for the family. This loan will improve his life a lot and it is a great opportunity which he will not throw away.

His dream is to have his own bees, because this is a very good business with high profits, and that his family is well.

loans.use: to buy two heifers.

loans.name: Isabel De Jesus

texts.es: Don Isabel es originario de la ciudad de Boaco. Es de oficio Agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de Maíz y Frijoles. Esta agradecido con Kiva y MiCredito ya que pudo mejorar la calidad de la cosecha y venderla a un mejor precio. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar una vaquilla y aumentar su ganado. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá obtener la vaquilla y tener un mejor ganado.
texts.en:
Don Isabel is from the city of Boaco. He is a farmer and he grows corn and beans. He is very grateful to Kiva and MiCredito because he could improve the quality of his crop and sell it at a better price.

He is asking for a new loan to buy a cow and increase the size of his herd. He thinks that the loan will help him since he can get a cow and improve his herd.

loans.use: to buy a cow and increase the size of his herd.

loans.name: Pamela Ivett

texts.es: La señora Pamela, junto a su esposo han decidido dedicarle lo mejor a sus dos hijos quienes se encuentran en edad escolar y parte de su prioridad es su vivienda, ella se didica a la actividad comercial de venta de cosmeticos y ropa su esposo es cadete de un taxi propio, el credito lo solicita para la compra de materiales de construccion como hierro, cemento, arena, bloques ya que de poquito a poquito ha levantado su casita, agradece le apoyo u confianza que Kiva y Afodenic le han brindado.
texts.en:
Pamela and her husband have decided to give the best to their two children, who are of school age, and one of the most important things is their home. Pamela works selling cosmetics and clothes and her husband has his own taxi. 

She is asking for a loan to buy construction materials like iron, cement, sand, and bricks because, little by little, she has built her own house.

She is grateful for the help and for the trust Kiva and Afodenic have placed in her.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Komera I Group

texts.fr:
Aline fait partie du groupe  Komera  I et habite à  Gitega. Elle  a 30 ans et est mariée  à Jean, un  commerçant.  

Elle fait le commerce de chèvres depuis  6 ans. 

Elle est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter   beaucoup de chèvres  à  revendre  pour gagner  plus.

Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait  faire l’élevage de chèvres   et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Aline, age 30, is part of Komera I Group and lives in Gitega. She's married to Jean, a merchant. For the past six years, she's been buying and selling goats.

She's seeking her third loan from Kiva's partner, Turame. With this Kiva loan, she will bolster her working capital and buy a lot of goats to resell and increase her income.

In the forthcoming years, she would like to raise goats and see her children go to school.

loans.use: to buy a lot of goats to resell

loans.name: Kenguruka Group

texts.fr:
Dévote fait partie du groupe  Kenguruka  et habite à  Gitega. Elle  a 35 ans et est mariée  à Alphonse, un  chauffeur.  

Elle fait le commerce de  poules  depuis 8 ans . 

Elle est à son treizième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter   beaucoup de  poules   à  revendre  pour gagner  plus.

Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait acheter une moto pour vendre le service de transport  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Dévote, age 35, is part of Kenguruka Group and lives in Gitega. She's married to Alphonse, a driver. For the past eight years, she's been buying and selling chicken.

She's seeking her thirteenth loan from Kiva's partner, Turame. With this Kiva loan, she will bolster her working capital and buy a lot of chickens to resell in order to increase her income.

In the forthcoming years, she would like to buy a motorcycle to sell transportation services and see her children go to school.

loans.use: to buy a lot of chickens to resell

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKADI ont en moyenne  33 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à   LAFIABOUGOU l’un des quartiers de la ville de SAN  dans la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des articles divers.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur  6 eme  prêt solidaire. SETOU  1ère  femme debout de  la gauche vers la droite sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des parures pour femmes, 20 poupées, 20 jeux pour enfants, 20 paires chaussures et 20 chapeaux. 
Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO auprès de différents grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce, en détail et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 26 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Benkadi Group are an average of 33 years of age, have an average of three children and are all living in traditional extended families in Lafiabougou, one of the districts of the city of San, in the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali. These women know one another through ties of kinship and through their businesses selling various goods. After having repaid their prior loans in full, the women of the Benkadi Group are on their sixth group loan.

Sétou, shown in the photo on the far left, intends to use her loan to purchase women's accessories, 20 dolls, 20 children's games, 20 pairs of shoes, and 20 hats. She purchases her goods in Bamako from several wholesalers. She sells her merchandise at retail for cash and often on credit, to a clientele composed of women and men.

Sétou hopes to earn an average monthly income of 26,000 Francs CFA, which she will use to pay for health expenses and school fees, with the remainder to be reinvested into her business.

loans.use: to purchase women's accessories, 20 dolls, 20 children's games, 20 pairs of shoes, and 20 hats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase electronics

loans.name: Agboinou Paul

texts.fr: Agboinou Paul âgé de 37 ans est marié à une coiffeuse du nom de Brigitte. Le couple à quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et aucun à leur charge. Agboinou Paul vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportées par le couple. Agboinou Paul n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour répondre aux besoins de sa famille, Agboinou Paul vend des pièces détachées pour automobiles et pour véhicules depuis cinq dans sa boutique sise dans sa région. Agboinou Paul s'approvisionne dans des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Agboinou Paul sollicite pour la deuxième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Agboinou Paul is 37 years old and married to a hairdresser named Brigitte. The couple has four children, some of whom attend school but none of whom are still in their care. Agboinou Paul lives together with his wife and children, and the couple provides for the various needs of the household.

Agboinou Paul did not attend school. To meet the needs of his family, he has sold spare parts for cars and other vehicles for five years in his shop in his region. He stocks up in the markets of Benin. In order to meet the needs of his customers, Agboinou Paul is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. His previous loan has been fully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DANAYA ont en moyenne  41 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à   MEDINE l’un des quartiers de la ville de SAN  dans la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de condiments et poissons.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur  5 eme  prêt solidaire. FATOUMATA  2 eme  femme assise à  la gauche sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 paquets de cube Maggi, 20kg d’oignons ,10kg de l’ail, 1 sac de sel, 10kg de piments et 1 panier de poisson fumé.  Elle s’approvisionne à SAN. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 36 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Danaya Group are an average of 41 years of age, have an average of four children and are all living in traditional extended families in Medine, one of the districts of the city of San, in the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali. These women know one another through ties of kinship and through their businesses selling "condiments" (vegetable-based sauces) and fish. After having repaid their prior loans in full, the women of the Danaya Group are on their fifth group loan.

Fatoumata, shown in the photo second from the left, intends to use her loan to purchase ten packets of Maggi (bouillon) cubes, 20 kg of onions, 10 kg of garlic, one sack of salt, 10 kg of peppers, and one basket of smoked fish. She purchases her goods in San. She sells her merchandise, for cash and often on credit, to a clientele composed of women and men.

Fatoumata hopes to earn an average monthly income of 36,000 Francs CFA, which she will use to pay for clothing and school fees, with the remainder to be reinvested into her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for "condiments" (vegetable-based sauces), and smoked fish.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
This is Magdalena, age 63, who is a resident of Malibay, Pasay, in the Philippines. She is married to Pacifico and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Magdalena operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by purchasing supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community members. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 40,000  loan to help her continue to operate her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Magdalena dreams that her business will continue to expand and hopes that her family will always live in good conditions. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en: Ruben is a fisherman from Bohol, Philippines. Ruben has been engaged in a fishing business for several years now. This is the source of his income. Ruben is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items. Through this loan, he will be able to improve his catch thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Ruben hopes to make his fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child in school, Joy works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from farming rice. Joy is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food-vending business.

Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food production.

loans.name: Àndres Abelino

texts.es:
Andrés de 44 años de edad vive, realizo sus estudios hasta segundo grado, ya que existían muchas limitantes para seguir estudiando y tenía que ayudarle a trabajar a su padre. Actualmente, está acompañado, su compañera de vida estudio hasta segundo grado también. Ella  se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos del hogar, tienen 3 hijos,  un niño de ocho años que actualmente está estudiando tercer grado en la escuela de la comunidad, una niña de 13 años de edad que está cursando octavo grado, ella asiste a una escuela que está ubicada en el municipio ya que en la escuela de la comunidad no hay grado para ella. El otro niño tiene 15 años, él dejo de asistir a la escuela menciona que otros niños lo molestaban y decidió ayudarle a trabajar a su padre para mejorar los ingresos en la familia.
Andrés se dedica a la pesca desde que tenis 10 años de edad,  fue el trabajo que su padre desempeñaba, con el cual ayudo a crecer a él y a sus hermanos  y que hoy en día él sigue desarrollando para brindarle lo necesario a su familia.  Andrés también se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando 3,500 metros cuadrados de maíz,  la cual le permite obtener los granos necesarios para su familia. El mar les queda muy cerca, ya que su casa está a pocos metros de distancia de la playa, la cual les permite acceder muy fácilmente a sus labores. Él y su hijo realizan la actividad de pesca en el día o en la noche según como este el movimiento de la marea como el menciona.
El dinero lo utilizara, para la compra de una lancha y motor que un amigo le vende la cual es más grande y potente que la que tiene, él ya tiene un poco de ese dinero que necesita ya que ha ahorrado de sus ganancias. Su visión es ampliar su negocio, ya que esto le permitiría pescar un poco más y la otra lancha poder dársela a alguien más y obtener otro ingreso más en el negocio de la pesca para darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en: Andrés is 44 and studied up to second form. He was not able to go further because there were many obstacles and he needed to help his father at work. He lives with his partner, who has the same level of education. She is a housewife, and together they have three children. The youngest is 8 and is in third form at the local school. The middle child, a girl, is 13 and is in eighth form. She has to attend school in the main town of the region, since there is no eighth form in the village where they live. The oldest is 15; he does not go to school anymore because he was bullied and instead decided to help his father at work in order to improve the family's income. Andrés has been a fisherman since he was 10 years old and learned the trade from his father, who was able to support André and his brother thanks to the proceeds from his fishing, a tradition Andrés now continues. Andrés is also a farmer: he grows 3,500 square metres of sweetcorn, which enable him to feed his family. They live very close to the sea, since their house is practically on the beach. This is convenient because it means he does not have to travel very far to go to work. He goes to sea with his son either during the day or at night, depending on the tide. He will use the loan to buy a more powerful boat and engine from a friend. Andrés already has some money of his own, which he saved towards this purchase. His goal is to expand his business, since he wants to bring in more fish. He would be able to lend the boat to someone else and, thanks to this small fleet, increase his income in order to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy a boat and an engine.

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es: Marta es una de las tres integrantes del grupo tiene la edad de 42 años, casada, con dos hijos, su negocio es la venta de repostería en Managua desde hace 5 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 5 años. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de repostería de canelados, torta de leche, rosquilla rivense, compra de delantal bordado, delantal normal. Ana mujer de 47 años su negocio es la venta de cosa de horno, Marbely de 29 años se dedica a la venta de ropa interior.
texts.en:
Marta is one of the three group members. She is 42, married, and has two children. For five years she has had a business selling pastries in Managua. She has been a customer of the organisation for 5 years. Marta needs the loan to buy cakes such as cinnamon pastries, bread pudding and doughnuts, as well as to purchase embroidered and plain aprons.

Ana is 47 and her business consists of selling Nicaraguan sweetbread.

Marbely is 29 and she works selling women's lingerie.
